6.english: And Moses said unto Aaron, and unto Eleazar and unto Ithamar, his sons: 'Let not the hair of your heads go loose, neither rend your clothes, that ye die not, and that He be not wroth with all the congregation; but let your brethren, the whole house of Israel, bewail the burning which the LORD hath kindled.

7.hebrew: åÌîÄôÌÆúÇç àÉäÆì îåÉòÅã ìÉà úÅöÀàåÌ, ôÌÆï-úÌÈîËúåÌ--ëÌÄé-ùÑÆîÆï îÄùÑÀçÇú éÀäåÈä, òÂìÅéëÆí; åÇéÌÇòÂùÒåÌ, ëÌÄãÀáÇø îÉùÑÆä.  {ô}
7.english: And ye shall not go out from the door of the tent of meeting, lest ye die; for the anointing oil of the LORD is upon you.' And they did according to the word of Moses. {P}

8.hebrew: åÇéÀãÇáÌÅø éÀäåÈä, àÆì-àÇäÂøÉï ìÅàîÉø.
8.english: And the LORD spoke unto Aaron, saying:

9.hebrew: éÇéÄï åÀùÑÅëÈø àÇì-úÌÅùÑÀúÌÀ àÇúÌÈä åÌáÈğÆéêÈ àÄúÌÈêÀ, áÌÀáÉàÂëÆí àÆì-àÉäÆì îåÉòÅã--åÀìÉà úÈîËúåÌ:  çË÷ÌÇú òåÉìÈí, ìÀãÉøÉúÅéëÆí.
9.english: 'Drink no wine nor strong drink, thou, nor thy sons with thee, when ye go into the tent of meeting, that ye die not; it shall be a statute forever throughout your generations.

10.hebrew: åÌìÀäÇáÀãÌÄéì, áÌÅéï äÇ÷ÌÉãÆùÑ åÌáÅéï äÇçÉì, åÌáÅéï äÇèÌÈîÅà, åÌáÅéï äÇèÌÈäåÉø.
10.english: And that ye may put difference between the holy and the common, and between the unclean and the clean;

11.hebrew: åÌìÀäåÉøÉú, àÆú-áÌÀğÅé éÄùÒÀøÈàÅì--àÅú, ëÌÈì-äÇçË÷ÌÄéí, àÂùÑÆø ãÌÄáÌÆø éÀäåÈä àÂìÅéäÆí, áÌÀéÇã-îÉùÑÆä.  {ô}
11.english: and that ye may teach the children of Israel all the statutes which the LORD hath spoken unto them by the hand of Moses.' {P}

12.hebrew: åÇéÀãÇáÌÅø îÉùÑÆä àÆì-àÇäÂøÉï, åÀàÆì àÆìÀòÈæÈø åÀàÆì-àÄéúÈîÈø áÌÈğÈéå äÇğÌåÉúÈøÄéí, ÷ÀçåÌ àÆú-äÇîÌÄğÀçÈä äÇğÌåÉúÆøÆú îÅàÄùÌÑÅé éÀäåÈä, åÀàÄëÀìåÌäÈ îÇöÌåÉú àÅöÆì äÇîÌÄæÀáÌÅçÇ:  ëÌÄé ÷ÉãÆùÑ ÷ÈãÈùÑÄéí, äÄåà.
12.english: And Moses spoke unto Aaron, and unto Eleazar and unto Ithamar, his sons that were left: 'Take the meal-offering that remaineth of the offerings of the LORD made by fire, and eat it without leaven beside the altar; for it is most holy.

13.hebrew: åÇàÂëÇìÀúÌÆí àÉúÈäÌ, áÌÀîÈ÷åÉí ÷ÈãåÉùÑ, ëÌÄé çÈ÷ÀêÈ åÀçÈ÷-áÌÈğÆéêÈ äÄåà, îÅàÄùÌÑÅé éÀäåÈä:  ëÌÄé-ëÅï, öËåÌÅéúÄé.
13.english: And ye shall eat it in a holy place, because it is thy due, and thy sons' due, of the offerings of the LORD made by fire; for so I am commanded.

14.hebrew: åÀàÅú çÂæÅä äÇúÌÀğåÌôÈä åÀàÅú ùÑåÉ÷ äÇúÌÀøåÌîÈä, úÌÉàëÀìåÌ áÌÀîÈ÷åÉí èÈäåÉø--àÇúÌÈä, åÌáÈğÆéêÈ åÌáÀğÉúÆéêÈ àÄúÌÈêÀ:  ëÌÄé-çÈ÷ÀêÈ åÀçÈ÷-áÌÈğÆéêÈ ğÄúÌÀğåÌ, îÄæÌÄáÀçÅé ùÑÇìÀîÅé áÌÀğÅé éÄùÒÀøÈàÅì.
14.english: And the breast of waving and the thigh of heaving shall ye eat in a clean place; thou, and thy sons, and thy daughters with thee; for they are given as thy due, and thy sons' due, out of the sacrifices of the peace-offerings of the children of Israel.

15.hebrew: ùÑåÉ÷ äÇúÌÀøåÌîÈä åÇçÂæÅä äÇúÌÀğåÌôÈä, òÇì àÄùÌÑÅé äÇçÂìÈáÄéí éÈáÄéàåÌ, ìÀäÈğÄéó úÌÀğåÌôÈä, ìÄôÀğÅé éÀäåÈä; åÀäÈéÈä ìÀêÈ åÌìÀáÈğÆéêÈ àÄúÌÀêÈ, ìÀçÈ÷-òåÉìÈí, ëÌÇàÂùÑÆø, öÄåÌÈä éÀäåÈä.
15.english: The thigh of heaving and the breast of waving shall they bring with the offerings of the fat made by fire, to wave it for a wave-offering before the LORD; and it shall be thine, and thy sons' with thee, as a due for ever; as the LORD hath commanded.'

16.hebrew: åÀàÅú ùÒÀòÄéø äÇçÇèÌÈàú, ãÌÈøÉùÑ ãÌÈøÇùÑ îÉùÑÆä--åÀäÄğÌÅä ùÒÉøÈó; åÇéÌÄ÷ÀöÉó òÇì-àÆìÀòÈæÈø åÀòÇì-àÄéúÈîÈø, áÌÀğÅé àÇäÂøÉï, äÇğÌåÉúÈøÄí, ìÅàîÉø.
16.english: And Moses diligently inquired for the goat of the sin-offering, and, behold, it was burnt; and he was angry with Eleazar and with Ithamar, the sons of Aaron that were left, saying:

17.hebrew: îÇãÌåÌòÇ, ìÉà-àÂëÇìÀúÌÆí àÆú-äÇçÇèÌÈàú áÌÄîÀ÷åÉí äÇ÷ÌÉãÆùÑ--ëÌÄé ÷ÉãÆùÑ ÷ÈãÈùÑÄéí, äÄåà; åÀàÉúÈäÌ ğÈúÇï ìÈëÆí, ìÈùÒÅàú àÆú-òÂåÊï äÈòÅãÈä, ìÀëÇôÌÅø òÂìÅéäÆí, ìÄôÀğÅé éÀäåÈä.
17.english: 'Wherefore have ye not eaten the sin-offering in the place of the sanctuary, seeing it is most holy, and He hath given it you to bear the iniquity of the congregation, to make atonement for them before the LORD?

18.hebrew: äÅï ìÉà-äåÌáÈà àÆú-ãÌÈîÈäÌ, àÆì-äÇ÷ÌÉãÆùÑ ôÌÀğÄéîÈä; àÈëåÉì úÌÉàëÀìåÌ àÉúÈäÌ áÌÇ÷ÌÉãÆùÑ, ëÌÇàÂùÑÆø öÄåÌÅéúÄé.
18.english: Behold, the blood of it was not brought into the sanctuary within; ye should certainly have eaten it in the sanctuary, as I commanded.'

19.hebrew: åÇéÀãÇáÌÅø àÇäÂøÉï àÆì-îÉùÑÆä, äÅï äÇéÌåÉí äÄ÷ÀøÄéáåÌ àÆú-çÇèÌÈàúÈí åÀàÆú-òÉìÈúÈí ìÄôÀğÅé éÀäåÈä, åÇúÌÄ÷ÀøÆàğÈä àÉúÄé, ëÌÈàÅìÌÆä; åÀàÈëÇìÀúÌÄé çÇèÌÈàú äÇéÌåÉí, äÇéÌÄéèÇá áÌÀòÅéğÅé éÀäåÈä.
19.english: And Aaron spoke unto Moses: 'Behold, this day have they offered their sin-offering and their burnt-offering before the LORD, and there have befallen me such things as these; and if I had eaten the sin-offering to-day, would it have been well-pleasing in the sight of the LORD?

20.hebrew: åÇéÌÄùÑÀîÇò îÉùÑÆä, åÇéÌÄéèÇá áÌÀòÅéğÈéå.  {ô}
20.english: And when Moses heard that, it was well-pleasing in his sight. {P}

1.hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּר יְהוָה אֶל-מֹשֶׁה וְאֶל-אַהֲרֹן, לֵאמֹר אֲלֵהֶם.
1.english: And the LORD spoke unto Moses and to Aaron, saying unto them:

2.hebrew: דַּבְּרוּ אֶל-בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל, לֵאמֹר:  זֹאת הַחַיָּה אֲשֶׁר תֹּאכְלוּ, מִכָּל-הַבְּהֵמָה אֲשֶׁר עַל-הָאָרֶץ.
2.english: Speak unto the children of Israel, saying: These are the living things which ye may eat among all the beasts that are on the earth.

3.hebrew: כֹּל מַפְרֶסֶת פַּרְסָה, וְשֹׁסַעַת שֶׁסַע פְּרָסֹת, מַעֲלַת גֵּרָה, בַּבְּהֵמָה--אֹתָהּ, תֹּאכֵלוּ.
3.english: Whatsoever parteth the hoof, and is wholly cloven-footed, and cheweth the cud, among the beasts, that may ye eat.

4.hebrew: אַךְ אֶת-זֶה, לֹא תֹאכְלוּ, מִמַּעֲלֵי הַגֵּרָה, וּמִמַּפְרִסֵי הַפַּרְסָה:  אֶת-הַגָּמָל כִּי-מַעֲלֵה גֵרָה הוּא, וּפַרְסָה אֵינֶנּוּ מַפְרִיס--טָמֵא הוּא, לָכֶם.
4.english: Nevertheless these shall ye not eat of them that only chew the cud, or of them that only part the hoof: the camel, because he cheweth the cud but parteth not the hoof, he is unclean unto you.

5.hebrew: וְאֶת-הַשָּׁפָן, כִּי-מַעֲלֵה גֵרָה הוּא, וּפַרְסָה, לֹא יַפְרִיס; טָמֵא הוּא, לָכֶם.
5.english: And the rock-badger, because he cheweth the cud but parteth not the hoof, he is unclean unto you.

6.hebrew: וְאֶת-הָאַרְנֶבֶת, כִּי-מַעֲלַת גֵּרָה הִוא, וּפַרְסָה, לֹא הִפְרִיסָה; טְמֵאָה הִוא, לָכֶם.
6.english: And the hare, because she cheweth the cud but parteth not the hoof, she is unclean unto you.

7.hebrew: וְאֶת-הַחֲזִיר כִּי-מַפְרִיס פַּרְסָה הוּא, וְשֹׁסַע שֶׁסַע פַּרְסָה, וְהוּא, גֵּרָה לֹא-יִגָּר; טָמֵא הוּא, לָכֶם.
7.english: And the swine, because he parteth the hoof, and is cloven-footed, but cheweth not the cud, he is unclean unto you.

8.hebrew: מִבְּשָׂרָם לֹא תֹאכֵלוּ, וּבְנִבְלָתָם לֹא תִגָּעוּ; טְמֵאִים הֵם, לָכֶם.
8.english: Of their flesh ye shall not eat, and their carcasses ye shall not touch; they are unclean unto you.

9.hebrew: אֶת-זֶה, תֹּאכְלוּ, מִכֹּל, אֲשֶׁר בַּמָּיִם:  כֹּל אֲשֶׁר-לוֹ סְנַפִּיר וְקַשְׂקֶשֶׂת בַּמַּיִם, בַּיַּמִּים וּבַנְּחָלִים--אֹתָם תֹּאכֵלוּ.
9.english: These may ye eat of all that are in the waters: whatsoever hath fins and scales in the waters, in the seas, and in the rivers, them may ye eat.

10.hebrew: וְכֹל אֲשֶׁר אֵין-לוֹ סְנַפִּיר וְקַשְׂקֶשֶׂת, בַּיַּמִּים וּבַנְּחָלִים, מִכֹּל שֶׁרֶץ הַמַּיִם, וּמִכֹּל נֶפֶשׁ הַחַיָּה אֲשֶׁר בַּמָּיִם--שֶׁקֶץ הֵם, לָכֶם.
10.english: And all that have not fins and scales in the seas, and in the rivers, of all that swarm in the waters, and of all the living creatures that are in the waters, they are a detestable thing unto you,

11.hebrew: וְשֶׁקֶץ, יִהְיוּ לָכֶם; מִבְּשָׂרָם לֹא תֹאכֵלוּ, וְאֶת-נִבְלָתָם תְּשַׁקֵּצוּ.
11.english: and they shall be a detestable thing unto you; ye shall not eat of their flesh, and their carcasses ye shall have in detestation.

12.hebrew: כֹּל אֲשֶׁר אֵין-לוֹ סְנַפִּיר וְקַשְׂקֶשֶׂת, בַּמָּיִם--שֶׁקֶץ הוּא, לָכֶם.
12.english: Whatsoever hath no fins nor scales in the waters, that is a detestable thing unto you.

13.hebrew: וְאֶת-אֵלֶּה תְּשַׁקְּצוּ מִן-הָעוֹף, לֹא יֵאָכְלוּ שֶׁקֶץ הֵם:  אֶת-הַנֶּשֶׁר, וְאֶת-הַפֶּרֶס, וְאֵת, הָעָזְנִיָּה.
13.english: And these ye shall have in detestation among the fowls; they shall not be eaten, they are a detestable thing: the great vulture, and the bearded vulture, and the ospray;

14.hebrew: וְאֶת-הַדָּאָה--וְאֶת-הָאַיָּה, לְמִינָהּ.
14.english: and the kite, and the falcon after its kinds;

15.hebrew: אֵת כָּל-עֹרֵב, לְמִינוֹ.
15.english: every raven after its kinds;

16.hebrew: וְאֵת בַּת הַיַּעֲנָה, וְאֶת-הַתַּחְמָס וְאֶת-הַשָּׁחַף; וְאֶת-הַנֵּץ, לְמִינֵהוּ.
16.english: and the ostrich, and the night-hawk, and the sea-mew, and the hawk after its kinds;

17.hebrew: וְאֶת-הַכּוֹס וְאֶת-הַשָּׁלָךְ, וְאֶת-הַיַּנְשׁוּף.
17.english: and the little owl, and the cormorant, and the great owl;

18.hebrew: וְאֶת-הַתִּנְשֶׁמֶת וְאֶת-הַקָּאָת, וְאֶת-הָרָחָם.
18.english: and the horned owl, and the pelican, and the carrion-vulture;

19.hebrew: וְאֵת, הַחֲסִידָה, הָאֲנָפָה, לְמִינָהּ; וְאֶת-הַדּוּכִיפַת, וְאֶת-הָעֲטַלֵּף.
19.english: and the stork, and the heron after its kinds, and the hoopoe, and the bat.

20.hebrew: כֹּל שֶׁרֶץ הָעוֹף, הַהֹלֵךְ עַל-אַרְבַּע--שֶׁקֶץ הוּא, לָכֶם.
20.english: All winged swarming things that go upon all fours are a detestable thing unto you.

21.hebrew: אַךְ אֶת-זֶה, תֹּאכְלוּ, מִכֹּל שֶׁרֶץ הָעוֹף, הַהֹלֵךְ עַל-אַרְבַּע:  אֲשֶׁר-לא (לוֹ) כְרָעַיִם מִמַּעַל לְרַגְלָיו, לְנַתֵּר בָּהֵן עַל-הָאָרֶץ.
21.english: Yet these may ye eat of all winged swarming things that go upon all fours, which have jointed legs above their feet, wherewith to leap upon the earth;

22.hebrew: אֶת-אֵלֶּה מֵהֶם, תֹּאכֵלוּ--אֶת-הָאַרְבֶּה לְמִינוֹ, וְאֶת-הַסָּלְעָם לְמִינֵהוּ; וְאֶת-הַחַרְגֹּל לְמִינֵהוּ, וְאֶת-הֶחָגָב לְמִינֵהוּ.
22.english: even these of them ye may eat: the locust after its kinds, and the bald locust after its kinds, and the cricket after its kinds, and the grasshopper after its kinds.

23.hebrew: וְכֹל שֶׁרֶץ הָעוֹף, אֲשֶׁר-לוֹ אַרְבַּע רַגְלָיִם--שֶׁקֶץ הוּא, לָכֶם.
23.english: But all winged swarming things, which have four feet, are a detestable thing unto you.

24.hebrew: וּלְאֵלֶּה, תִּטַּמָּאוּ; כָּל-הַנֹּגֵעַ בְּנִבְלָתָם, יִטְמָא עַד-הָעָרֶב.
24.english: And by these ye shall become unclean; whosoever toucheth the carcass of them shall be unclean until even.

25.english: And whosoever beareth aught of the carcass of them shall wash his clothes, and be unclean until the even.

26.hebrew: לְכָל-הַבְּהֵמָה אֲשֶׁר הִוא מַפְרֶסֶת פַּרְסָה וְשֶׁסַע אֵינֶנָּה שֹׁסַעַת, וְגֵרָה אֵינֶנָּה מַעֲלָה--טְמֵאִים הֵם, לָכֶם; כָּל-הַנֹּגֵעַ בָּהֶם, יִטְמָא.
26.english: Every beast which parteth the hoof, but is not cloven footed, nor cheweth the cud, is unclean unto you; every one that toucheth them shall be unclean.

27.hebrew: וְכֹל הוֹלֵךְ עַל-כַּפָּיו, בְּכָל-הַחַיָּה הַהֹלֶכֶת עַל-אַרְבַּע--טְמֵאִים הֵם, לָכֶם; כָּל-הַנֹּגֵעַ בְּנִבְלָתָם, יִטְמָא עַד-הָעָרֶב.
27.english: And whatsoever goeth upon its paws, among all beasts that go on all fours, they are unclean unto you; whoso toucheth their carcass shall be unclean until the even.

28.hebrew: וְהַנֹּשֵׂא, אֶת-נִבְלָתָם--יְכַבֵּס בְּגָדָיו, וְטָמֵא עַד-הָעָרֶב; טְמֵאִים הֵמָּה, לָכֶם.  {ס}
28.english: And he that beareth the carcass of them shall wash his clothes, and be unclean until the even; they are unclean unto you. {S}

29.hebrew: וְזֶה לָכֶם הַטָּמֵא, בַּשֶּׁרֶץ הַשֹּׁרֵץ עַל-הָאָרֶץ:  הַחֹלֶד וְהָעַכְבָּר, וְהַצָּב לְמִינֵהוּ.
29.english: And these are they which are unclean unto you among the swarming things that swarm upon the earth: the weasel, and the mouse, and the great lizard after its kinds,

30.english: and the gecko, and the land-crocodile, and the lizard, and the sand-lizard, and the chameleon.

31.hebrew: אֵלֶּה הַטְּמֵאִים לָכֶם, בְּכָל-הַשָּׁרֶץ; כָּל-הַנֹּגֵעַ בָּהֶם בְּמֹתָם, יִטְמָא עַד-הָעָרֶב.
31.english: These are they which are unclean to you among all that swarm; whosoever doth touch them, when they are dead, shall be unclean until the even.

32.hebrew: וְכֹל אֲשֶׁר-יִפֹּל-עָלָיו מֵהֶם בְּמֹתָם יִטְמָא, מִכָּל-כְּלִי-עֵץ אוֹ בֶגֶד אוֹ-עוֹר אוֹ שָׂק, כָּל-כְּלִי, אֲשֶׁר-יֵעָשֶׂה מְלָאכָה בָּהֶם; בַּמַּיִם יוּבָא וְטָמֵא עַד-הָעֶרֶב, וְטָהֵר.
32.english: And upon whatsoever any of them, when they are dead, doth fall, it shall be unclean; whether it be any vessel of wood, or raiment, or skin, or sack, whatsoever vessel it be, wherewith any work is done, it must be put into water, and it shall be unclean until the even; then shall it be clean.

33.hebrew: וְכָל-כְּלִי-חֶרֶשׂ--אֲשֶׁר-יִפֹּל מֵהֶם, אֶל-תּוֹכוֹ:  כֹּל אֲשֶׁר בְּתוֹכוֹ יִטְמָא, וְאֹתוֹ תִשְׁבֹּרוּ.
33.english: And every earthen vessel whereinto any of them falleth, whatsoever is in it shall be unclean, and it ye shall break.

34.hebrew: מִכָּל-הָאֹכֶל אֲשֶׁר יֵאָכֵל, אֲשֶׁר יָבוֹא עָלָיו מַיִם--יִטְמָא; וְכָל-מַשְׁקֶה אֲשֶׁר יִשָּׁתֶה, בְּכָל-כְּלִי יִטְמָא.
34.english: All food therein which may be eaten, that on which water cometh, shall be unclean; and all drink in every such vessel that may be drunk shall be unclean.

35.hebrew: וְכֹל אֲשֶׁר-יִפֹּל מִנִּבְלָתָם עָלָיו, יִטְמָא--תַּנּוּר וְכִירַיִם יֻתָּץ, טְמֵאִים הֵם; וּטְמֵאִים, יִהְיוּ לָכֶם.
35.english: And every thing whereupon any part of their carcass falleth shall be unclean; whether oven, or range for pots, it shall be broken in pieces; they are unclean, and shall be unclean unto you.

36.hebrew: אַךְ מַעְיָן וּבוֹר מִקְוֵה-מַיִם, יִהְיֶה טָהוֹר; וְנֹגֵעַ בְּנִבְלָתָם, יִטְמָא.
36.english: Nevertheless a fountain or a cistern wherein is a gathering of water shall be clean; but he who toucheth their carcass shall be unclean.

37.hebrew: וְכִי יִפֹּל מִנִּבְלָתָם, עַל-כָּל-זֶרַע זֵרוּעַ אֲשֶׁר יִזָּרֵעַ--טָהוֹר, הוּא.
37.english: And if aught of their carcass fall upon any sowing seed which is to be sown, it is clean.

38.hebrew: וְכִי יֻתַּן-מַיִם עַל-זֶרַע, וְנָפַל מִנִּבְלָתָם עָלָיו--טָמֵא הוּא, לָכֶם.  {ס}
38.english: But if water be put upon the seed, and aught of their carcass fall thereon, it is unclean unto you. {S}

39.hebrew: וְכִי יָמוּת מִן-הַבְּהֵמָה, אֲשֶׁר-הִיא לָכֶם לְאָכְלָה--הַנֹּגֵעַ בְּנִבְלָתָהּ, יִטְמָא עַד-הָעָרֶב.
39.english: And if any beast, of which ye may eat, die, he that toucheth the carcass thereof shall be unclean until the even.

40.hebrew: וְהָאֹכֵל, מִנִּבְלָתָהּ--יְכַבֵּס בְּגָדָיו, וְטָמֵא עַד-הָעָרֶב; וְהַנֹּשֵׂא, אֶת-נִבְלָתָהּ--יְכַבֵּס בְּגָדָיו, וְטָמֵא עַד-הָעָרֶב.
40.english: And he that eateth of the carcass of it shall wash his clothes, and be unclean until the even; he also that beareth the carcass of it shall wash his clothes, and be unclean until the even.

41.hebrew: וְכָל-הַשֶּׁרֶץ, הַשֹּׁרֵץ עַל-הָאָרֶץ--שֶׁקֶץ הוּא, לֹא יֵאָכֵל.
41.english: And every swarming thing that swarmeth upon the earth is a detestable thing; it shall not be eaten.

42.hebrew: כֹּל הוֹלֵךְ עַל-גָּחוֹן וְכֹל הוֹלֵךְ עַל-אַרְבַּע, עַד כָּל-מַרְבֵּה רַגְלַיִם, לְכָל-הַשֶּׁרֶץ, הַשֹּׁרֵץ עַל-הָאָרֶץ--לֹא תֹאכְלוּם, כִּי-שֶׁקֶץ הֵם.
42.english: Whatsoever goeth upon the belly, and whatsoever goeth upon all fours, or whatsoever hath many feet, even all swarming things that swarm upon the earth, them ye shall not eat; for they are a detestable thing.

43.hebrew: אַל-תְּשַׁקְּצוּ, אֶת-נַפְשֹׁתֵיכֶם, בְּכָל-הַשֶּׁרֶץ, הַשֹּׁרֵץ; וְלֹא תִטַּמְּאוּ בָּהֶם, וְנִטְמֵתֶם בָּם.
43.english: Ye shall not make yourselves detestable with any swarming thing that swarmeth, neither shall ye make yourselves unclean with them, that ye should be defiled thereby.

44.hebrew: כִּי אֲנִי יְהוָה, אֱלֹהֵיכֶם, וְהִתְקַדִּשְׁתֶּם וִהְיִיתֶם קְדֹשִׁים, כִּי קָדוֹשׁ אָנִי; וְלֹא תְטַמְּאוּ אֶת-נַפְשֹׁתֵיכֶם, בְּכָל-הַשֶּׁרֶץ הָרֹמֵשׂ עַל-הָאָרֶץ.
44.english: For I am the LORD your God; sanctify yourselves therefore, and be ye holy; for I am holy; neither shall ye defile yourselves with any manner of swarming thing that moveth upon the earth.

45.hebrew: כִּי אֲנִי יְהוָה, הַמַּעֲלֶה אֶתְכֶם מֵאֶרֶץ מִצְרַיִם, לִהְיֹת לָכֶם, לֵאלֹהִים; וִהְיִיתֶם קְדֹשִׁים, כִּי קָדוֹשׁ אָנִי.
45.english: For I am the LORD that brought you up out of the land of Egypt, to be your God; ye shall therefore be holy, for I am holy.

46.hebrew: זֹאת תּוֹרַת הַבְּהֵמָה, וְהָעוֹף, וְכֹל נֶפֶשׁ הַחַיָּה, הָרֹמֶשֶׂת בַּמָּיִם; וּלְכָל-נֶפֶשׁ, הַשֹּׁרֶצֶת עַל-הָאָרֶץ.
46.english: This is the law of the beast, and of the fowl, and of every living creature that moveth in the waters, and of every creature that swarmeth upon the earth;

47.hebrew: לְהַבְדִּיל, בֵּין הַטָּמֵא וּבֵין הַטָּהֹר; וּבֵין הַחַיָּה, הַנֶּאֱכֶלֶת, וּבֵין הַחַיָּה, אֲשֶׁר לֹא תֵאָכֵל.  {פ}
47.english: to make a difference between the unclean and the clean, and between the living thing that may be eaten and the living thing that may not be eaten. {P}

1.english: And the LORD spoke unto Moses, saying:

2.hebrew: ††гћ«бћ≈ш а∆м-бћјр≈й йƒщ“јш»а≈м, м≈ао…ш, аƒщћ—»д лћƒй ъ«жјшƒйт«, ејй»мјг»д ж»л»ш--еји»оја»д щ—ƒбјт«ъ й»оƒйн, лћƒйо≈й рƒгћ«ъ гћје ъ»дћ ъћƒијо»а.
2.english: Speak unto the children of Israel, saying: If a woman be delivered, and bear a man-child, then she shall be unclean seven days; as in the days of the impurity of her sickness shall she be unclean.

3.hebrew: ††ећб«йће…н, д«щћ—јоƒйрƒй, йƒоће…м, бћјщ“«ш т»шјм»ъе….
3.english: And in the eighth day the flesh of his foreskin shall be circumcised.

4.hebrew: ††ећщ—јм…щ—ƒйн йе…н ећщ—јм…щ—∆ъ й»оƒйн, ъћ≈щ—≈б бћƒгјо≈й и»д√ш»д; бћјл»м-ч…г∆щ— м…а-ъƒвћ»т, еја∆м-д«оћƒчјгћ»щ— м…а ъ»б…а, т«г-ојм…аъ, йјо≈й и»д√ш»дћ.
4.english: And she shall continue in the blood of purification three and thirty days; she shall touch no hallowed thing, nor come into the sanctuary, until the days of her purification be fulfilled.

5.hebrew: ††ејаƒн-рјч≈б»д ъ≈м≈г, еји»оја»д щ—јбЋт«йƒн лћјрƒгћ»ъ»дћ; ејщ—ƒщћ—ƒйн йе…н ејщ—≈щ—∆ъ й»оƒйн, ъћ≈щ—≈б т«м-гћјо≈й и»д√ш»д.
5.english: But if she bear a maid-child, then she shall be unclean two weeks, as in her impurity; and she shall continue in the blood of purification threescore and six days.

6.hebrew: ††ећбƒојм…аъ йјо≈й и»д√ш»дћ, мјб≈п ае… мјб«ъ, ъћ»бƒйа лћ∆б∆щ“ бћ∆п-щ—јр»ъе… мјт…м»д, ећб∆п-йе…р»д ае…-ъ…ш мјз«ић»аъ--а∆м-фћ∆ъ«з а…д∆м-ое…т≈г, а∆м-д«лћ…д≈п.
6.english: And when the days of her purification are fulfilled, for a son, or for a daughter, she shall bring a lamb of the first year for a burnt-offering, and a young pigeon, or a turtle-dove, for a sin-offering, unto the door of the tent of meeting, unto the priest.

7.hebrew: ††ејдƒчјшƒйбе… мƒфјр≈й йјде»д, ејлƒфћ∆ш т»м∆йд», еји»д¬ш»д, оƒоћјч…ш гћ»о∆йд»:† ж…аъ ъће…ш«ъ д«йћ…м∆г∆ъ, м«жћ»л»ш ае… м«рћјч≈б»д.
7.english: And he shall offer it before the LORD, and make atonement for her; and she shall be cleansed from the fountain of her blood. This is the law for her that beareth, whether a male or a female.

8.hebrew: ††ејаƒн-м…а ъƒојц»а й»г»дћ, гћ≈й щ“∆д--ејм»чјз»д щ—јъћ≈й-ъ…шƒйн ае… щ—јр≈й бћјр≈й йе…р»д, а∆з»г мјт…м»д еја∆з»г мјз«ић»аъ; ејлƒфћ∆ш т»м∆йд» д«лћ…д≈п, еји»д≈ш»д.† {ф}
8.english: And if her means suffice not for a lamb, then she shall take two turtle-doves, or two young pigeons: the one for a burnt-offering, and the other for a sin-offering; and the priest shall make atonement for her, and she shall be clean. {P}

1.english: And the LORD spoke unto Moses and unto Aaron, saying:

2.hebrew: אָדָם, כִּי-יִהְיֶה בְעוֹר-בְּשָׂרוֹ שְׂאֵת אוֹ-סַפַּחַת אוֹ בַהֶרֶת, וְהָיָה בְעוֹר-בְּשָׂרוֹ, לְנֶגַע צָרָעַת--וְהוּבָא אֶל-אַהֲרֹן הַכֹּהֵן, אוֹ אֶל-אַחַד מִבָּנָיו הַכֹּהֲנִים.
2.english: When a man shall have in the skin of his flesh a rising, or a scab, or a bright spot, and it become in the skin of his flesh the plague of leprosy, then he shall be brought unto Aaron the priest, or unto one of his sons the priests.

3.hebrew: וְרָאָה הַכֹּהֵן אֶת-הַנֶּגַע בְּעוֹר-הַבָּשָׂר וְשֵׂעָר בַּנֶּגַע הָפַךְ לָבָן, וּמַרְאֵה הַנֶּגַע עָמֹק מֵעוֹר בְּשָׂרוֹ--נֶגַע צָרַעַת, הוּא; וְרָאָהוּ הַכֹּהֵן, וְטִמֵּא אֹתוֹ.
3.english: And the priest shall look upon the plague in the skin of the flesh; and if the hair in the plague be turned white, and the appearance of the plague be deeper than the skin of his flesh, it is the plague of leprosy; and the priest shall look on him, and pronounce him unclean.

4.hebrew: וְאִם-בַּהֶרֶת לְבָנָה הִוא בְּעוֹר בְּשָׂרוֹ, וְעָמֹק אֵין-מַרְאֶהָ מִן-הָעוֹר, וּשְׂעָרָה, לֹא-הָפַךְ לָבָן--וְהִסְגִּיר הַכֹּהֵן אֶת-הַנֶּגַע, שִׁבְעַת יָמִים.
4.english: And if the bright spot be white in the skin of his flesh, and the appearance thereof be not deeper than the skin, and the hair thereof be not turned white, then the priest shall shut up him that hath the plague seven days.

5.hebrew: וְרָאָהוּ הַכֹּהֵן, בַּיּוֹם הַשְּׁבִיעִי, וְהִנֵּה הַנֶּגַע עָמַד בְּעֵינָיו, לֹא-פָשָׂה הַנֶּגַע בָּעוֹר--וְהִסְגִּירוֹ הַכֹּהֵן שִׁבְעַת יָמִים, שֵׁנִית.
5.english: And the priest shall look on him the seventh day; and, behold, if the plague stay in its appearance, and the plague be not spread in the skin, then the priest shall shut him up seven days more.

6.hebrew: וְרָאָה הַכֹּהֵן אֹתוֹ בַּיּוֹם הַשְּׁבִיעִי, שֵׁנִית, וְהִנֵּה כֵּהָה הַנֶּגַע, וְלֹא-פָשָׂה הַנֶּגַע בָּעוֹר--וְטִהֲרוֹ הַכֹּהֵן מִסְפַּחַת הִוא, וְכִבֶּס בְּגָדָיו וְטָהֵר.
6.english: And the priest shall look on him again the seventh day; and, behold, if the plague be dim, and the plague be not spread in the skin, then the priest shall pronounce him clean: it is a scab; and he shall wash his clothes, and be clean.

7.hebrew: וְאִם-פָּשֹׂה תִפְשֶׂה הַמִּסְפַּחַת בָּעוֹר, אַחֲרֵי הֵרָאֹתוֹ אֶל-הַכֹּהֵן לְטָהֳרָתוֹ; וְנִרְאָה שֵׁנִית, אֶל-הַכֹּהֵן.
7.english: But if the scab spread abroad in the skin, after that he hath shown himself to the priest for his cleansing, he shall show himself to the priest again.

8.hebrew: וְרָאָה, הַכֹּהֵן, וְהִנֵּה פָּשְׂתָה הַמִּסְפַּחַת, בָּעוֹר--וְטִמְּאוֹ הַכֹּהֵן, צָרַעַת הִוא.  {פ}
8.english: And the priest shall look, and, behold, if the scab be spread in the skin, then the priest shall pronounce him unclean: it is leprosy. {P}

9.hebrew: נֶגַע צָרַעַת, כִּי תִהְיֶה בְּאָדָם; וְהוּבָא, אֶל-הַכֹּהֵן.
9.english: When the plague of leprosy is in a man, then he shall be brought unto the priest.

10.hebrew: וְרָאָה הַכֹּהֵן, וְהִנֵּה שְׂאֵת-לְבָנָה בָּעוֹר, וְהִיא, הָפְכָה שֵׂעָר לָבָן; וּמִחְיַת בָּשָׂר חַי, בַּשְׂאֵת.
10.english: And the priest shall look, and, behold, if there be a white rising in the skin, and it have turned the hair white, and there be quick raw flesh in the rising,

11.hebrew: צָרַעַת נוֹשֶׁנֶת הִוא בְּעוֹר בְּשָׂרוֹ, וְטִמְּאוֹ הַכֹּהֵן:  לֹא יַסְגִּרֶנּוּ, כִּי טָמֵא הוּא.
11.english: it is an old leprosy in the skin of his flesh, and the priest shall pronounce him unclean; he shall not shut him up; for he is unclean.

12.hebrew: וְאִם-פָּרוֹחַ תִּפְרַח הַצָּרַעַת, בָּעוֹר, וְכִסְּתָה הַצָּרַעַת אֵת כָּל-עוֹר הַנֶּגַע, מֵרֹאשׁוֹ וְעַד-רַגְלָיו--לְכָל-מַרְאֵה, עֵינֵי הַכֹּהֵן.
12.english: And if the leprosy break out abroad in the skin, and the leprosy cover all the skin of him that hath the plague from his head even to his feet, as far as appeareth to the priest;

13.hebrew: וְרָאָה הַכֹּהֵן, וְהִנֵּה כִסְּתָה הַצָּרַעַת אֶת-כָּל-בְּשָׂרוֹ--וְטִהַר, אֶת-הַנָּגַע:  כֻּלּוֹ הָפַךְ לָבָן, טָהוֹר הוּא.
13.english: then the priest shall look; and, behold, if the leprosy have covered all his flesh, he shall pronounce him clean that hath the plague; it is all turned white: he is clean.

14.hebrew: וּבְיוֹם הֵרָאוֹת בּוֹ בָּשָׂר חַי, יִטְמָא.
14.english: But whensoever raw flesh appeareth in him, he shall be unclean.

15.hebrew: וְרָאָה הַכֹּהֵן אֶת-הַבָּשָׂר הַחַי, וְטִמְּאוֹ:  הַבָּשָׂר הַחַי טָמֵא הוּא, צָרַעַת הוּא.
15.english: And the priest shall look on the raw flesh, and pronounce him unclean; the raw flesh is unclean: it is leprosy.

16.hebrew: אוֹ כִי יָשׁוּב הַבָּשָׂר הַחַי, וְנֶהְפַּךְ לְלָבָן; וּבָא, אֶל-הַכֹּהֵן.
16.english: But if the raw flesh again be turned into white, then he shall come unto the priest;

17.hebrew: וְרָאָהוּ, הַכֹּהֵן, וְהִנֵּה נֶהְפַּךְ הַנֶּגַע, לְלָבָן--וְטִהַר הַכֹּהֵן אֶת-הַנֶּגַע, טָהוֹר הוּא.  {פ}
17.english: and the priest shall look on him; and, behold, if the plague be turned into white, then the priest shall pronounce him clean that hath the plague: he is clean. {P}

18.hebrew: וּבָשָׂר, כִּי-יִהְיֶה בוֹ-בְעֹרוֹ שְׁחִין; וְנִרְפָּא.
18.english: And when the flesh hath in the skin thereof a boil, and it is healed,

19.hebrew: וְהָיָה בִּמְקוֹם הַשְּׁחִין, שְׂאֵת לְבָנָה, אוֹ בַהֶרֶת, לְבָנָה אֲדַמְדָּמֶת; וְנִרְאָה, אֶל-הַכֹּהֵן.
19.english: and in the place of the boil there is a white rising, or a bright spot, reddish-white, then it shall be shown to the priest.

20.hebrew: וְרָאָה הַכֹּהֵן, וְהִנֵּה מַרְאֶהָ שָׁפָל מִן-הָעוֹר, וּשְׂעָרָהּ, הָפַךְ לָבָן--וְטִמְּאוֹ הַכֹּהֵן נֶגַע-צָרַעַת הִוא, בַּשְּׁחִין פָּרָחָה.
20.english: And the priest shall look; and, behold, if the appearance thereof be lower than the skin, and the hair thereof be turned white, then the priest shall pronounce him unclean: it is the plague of leprosy, it hath broken out in the boil.

21.hebrew: וְאִם יִרְאֶנָּה הַכֹּהֵן, וְהִנֵּה אֵין-בָּהּ שֵׂעָר לָבָן, וּשְׁפָלָה אֵינֶנָּה מִן-הָעוֹר, וְהִיא כֵהָה--וְהִסְגִּירוֹ הַכֹּהֵן, שִׁבְעַת יָמִים.
21.english: But if the priest look on it, and, behold, there be no white hairs therein, and it be not lower than the skin, but be dim, then the priest shall shut him up seven days.

22.hebrew: וְאִם-פָּשֹׂה תִפְשֶׂה, בָּעוֹר--וְטִמֵּא הַכֹּהֵן אֹתוֹ, נֶגַע הִוא.
22.english: And if it spread abroad in the skin, then the priest shall pronounce him unclean: it is a plague.

23.hebrew: וְאִם-תַּחְתֶּיהָ תַּעֲמֹד הַבַּהֶרֶת, לֹא פָשָׂתָה--צָרֶבֶת הַשְּׁחִין, הִוא; וְטִהֲרוֹ, הַכֹּהֵן.  {ס}
23.english: But if the bright spot stay in its place, and be not spread, it is the scar of the boil; and the priest shall pronounce him clean. {S}

24.hebrew: אוֹ בָשָׂר, כִּי-יִהְיֶה בְעֹרוֹ מִכְוַת-אֵשׁ; וְהָיְתָה מִחְיַת הַמִּכְוָה, בַּהֶרֶת לְבָנָה אֲדַמְדֶּמֶת--אוֹ לְבָנָה.
24.english: Or when the flesh hath in the skin thereof a burning by fire, and the quick flesh of the burning become a bright spot, reddish-white, or white;

25.hebrew: וְרָאָה אֹתָהּ הַכֹּהֵן וְהִנֵּה נֶהְפַּךְ שֵׂעָר לָבָן בַּבַּהֶרֶת, וּמַרְאֶהָ עָמֹק מִן-הָעוֹר--צָרַעַת הִוא, בַּמִּכְוָה פָּרָחָה; וְטִמֵּא אֹתוֹ הַכֹּהֵן, נֶגַע צָרַעַת הִוא.
25.english: then the priest shall look upon it; and, behold, if the hair in the bright spot be turned white, and the appearance thereof be deeper than the skin, it is leprosy, it hath broken out in the burning; and the priest shall pronounce him unclean: it is the plague of leprosy.

26.hebrew: וְאִם יִרְאֶנָּה הַכֹּהֵן, וְהִנֵּה אֵין-בַּבַּהֶרֶת שֵׂעָר לָבָן, וּשְׁפָלָה אֵינֶנָּה מִן-הָעוֹר, וְהִוא כֵהָה--וְהִסְגִּירוֹ הַכֹּהֵן, שִׁבְעַת יָמִים.
26.english: But if the priest look on it, and, behold, there be no white hair in the bright spot, and it be no lower than the skin, but be dim; then the priest shall shut him up seven days.

27.hebrew: וְרָאָהוּ הַכֹּהֵן, בַּיּוֹם הַשְּׁבִיעִי:  אִם-פָּשֹׂה תִפְשֶׂה, בָּעוֹר--וְטִמֵּא הַכֹּהֵן אֹתוֹ, נֶגַע צָרַעַת הִוא.
27.english: And the priest shall look upon him the seventh day; if it spread abroad in the skin, then the priest shall pronounce him unclean: it is the plague of leprosy.

28.hebrew: וְאִם-תַּחְתֶּיהָ תַעֲמֹד הַבַּהֶרֶת לֹא-פָשְׂתָה בָעוֹר, וְהִוא כֵהָה--שְׂאֵת הַמִּכְוָה, הִוא; וְטִהֲרוֹ, הַכֹּהֵן--כִּי-צָרֶבֶת הַמִּכְוָה, הִוא.  {פ}
28.english: And if the bright spot stay in its place, and be not spread in the skin, but be dim, it is the rising of the burning, and the priest shall pronounce him clean; for it is the scar of the burning. {P}

29.hebrew: וְאִישׁ אוֹ אִשָּׁה, כִּי-יִהְיֶה בוֹ נָגַע, בְּרֹאשׁ, אוֹ בְזָקָן.
29.english: And when a man or woman hath a plague upon the head or upon the beard,

30.hebrew: וְרָאָה הַכֹּהֵן אֶת-הַנֶּגַע, וְהִנֵּה מַרְאֵהוּ עָמֹק מִן-הָעוֹר, וּבוֹ שֵׂעָר צָהֹב, דָּק--וְטִמֵּא אֹתוֹ הַכֹּהֵן נֶתֶק הוּא, צָרַעַת הָרֹאשׁ אוֹ הַזָּקָן הוּא.
30.english: then the priest shall look on the plague; and, behold, if the appearance thereof be deeper than the skin, and there be in it yellow thin hair, then the priest shall pronounce him unclean: it is a scall, it is leprosy of the head or of the beard.

31.hebrew: וְכִי-יִרְאֶה הַכֹּהֵן אֶת-נֶגַע הַנֶּתֶק, וְהִנֵּה אֵין-מַרְאֵהוּ עָמֹק מִן-הָעוֹר, וְשֵׂעָר שָׁחֹר, אֵין בּוֹ--וְהִסְגִּיר הַכֹּהֵן אֶת-נֶגַע הַנֶּתֶק, שִׁבְעַת יָמִים.
31.english: And if the priest look on the plague of the scall, and, behold, the appearance thereof be not deeper than the skin, and there be no black hair in it, then the priest shall shut up him that hath the plague of the scall seven days.

32.hebrew: וְרָאָה הַכֹּהֵן אֶת-הַנֶּגַע, בַּיּוֹם הַשְּׁבִיעִי, וְהִנֵּה לֹא-פָשָׂה הַנֶּתֶק, וְלֹא-הָיָה בוֹ שֵׂעָר צָהֹב; וּמַרְאֵה הַנֶּתֶק, אֵין עָמֹק מִן-הָעוֹר.
32.english: And in the seventh day the priest shall look on the plague; and, behold, if the scall be not spread, and there be in it no yellow hair, and the appearance of the scall be not deeper than the skin,

33.hebrew: וְהִתְגַּלָּח--וְאֶת-הַנֶּתֶק, לֹא יְגַלֵּחַ; וְהִסְגִּיר הַכֹּהֵן אֶת-הַנֶּתֶק שִׁבְעַת יָמִים, שֵׁנִית.
33.english: then he shall be shaven, but the scall shall he not shave; and the priest shall shut up him that hath the scall seven days more.

34.hebrew: וְרָאָה הַכֹּהֵן אֶת-הַנֶּתֶק בַּיּוֹם הַשְּׁבִיעִי, וְהִנֵּה לֹא-פָשָׂה הַנֶּתֶק בָּעוֹר, וּמַרְאֵהוּ, אֵינֶנּוּ עָמֹק מִן-הָעוֹר--וְטִהַר אֹתוֹ הַכֹּהֵן, וְכִבֶּס בְּגָדָיו וְטָהֵר.
34.english: And in the seventh day the priest shall look on the scall; and, behold, if the scall be not spread in the skin, and the appearance thereof be not deeper than the skin, then the priest shall pronounce him clean; and he shall wash his clothes, and be clean.

35.hebrew: וְאִם-פָּשֹׂה יִפְשֶׂה הַנֶּתֶק, בָּעוֹר, אַחֲרֵי, טָהֳרָתוֹ.
35.english: But if the scall spread abroad in the skin after his cleansing,

36.hebrew: וְרָאָהוּ, הַכֹּהֵן, וְהִנֵּה פָּשָׂה הַנֶּתֶק, בָּעוֹר--לֹא-יְבַקֵּר הַכֹּהֵן לַשֵּׂעָר הַצָּהֹב, טָמֵא הוּא.
36.english: then the priest shall look on him; and, behold, if the scall be spread in the skin, the priest shall not seek for the yellow hair: he is unclean.

37.hebrew: וְאִם-בְּעֵינָיו עָמַד הַנֶּתֶק וְשֵׂעָר שָׁחֹר צָמַח-בּוֹ, נִרְפָּא הַנֶּתֶק--טָהוֹר הוּא; וְטִהֲרוֹ, הַכֹּהֵן.  {ס}
37.english: But if the scall stay in its appearance, and black hair be grown up therein; the scall is healed, he is clean; and the priest shall pronounce him clean. {S}

38.hebrew: וְאִישׁ, אוֹ-אִשָּׁה, כִּי-יִהְיֶה בְעוֹר-בְּשָׂרָם, בֶּהָרֹת--בֶּהָרֹת, לְבָנֹת.
38.english: And if a man or a woman have in the skin of their flesh bright spots, even white bright spots;

39.hebrew: וְרָאָה הַכֹּהֵן, וְהִנֵּה בְעוֹר-בְּשָׂרָם בֶּהָרֹת--כֵּהוֹת לְבָנֹת:  בֹּהַק הוּא פָּרַח בָּעוֹר, טָהוֹר הוּא.  {ס}
39.english: then the priest shall look; and, behold, if the bright spots in the skin of their flesh be of a dull white, it is a tetter, it hath broken out in the skin: he is clean. {S}

40.hebrew: וְאִישׁ, כִּי יִמָּרֵט רֹאשׁוֹ--קֵרֵחַ הוּא, טָהוֹר הוּא.
40.english: And if a man's hair be fallen off his head, he is bald; yet is he clean.

41.hebrew: וְאִם מִפְּאַת פָּנָיו, יִמָּרֵט רֹאשׁוֹ--גִּבֵּחַ הוּא, טָהוֹר הוּא.
41.english: And if his hair be fallen off from the front part of his head, he is forehead-bald; yet is he clean.

42.hebrew: וְכִי-יִהְיֶה בַקָּרַחַת אוֹ בַגַּבַּחַת, נֶגַע לָבָן אֲדַמְדָּם--צָרַעַת פֹּרַחַת הִוא, בְּקָרַחְתּוֹ אוֹ בְגַבַּחְתּוֹ.
42.english: But if there be in the bald head, or the bald forehead, a reddish-white plague, it is leprosy breaking out in his bald head, or his bald forehead.

43.hebrew: וְרָאָה אֹתוֹ הַכֹּהֵן, וְהִנֵּה שְׂאֵת-הַנֶּגַע לְבָנָה אֲדַמְדֶּמֶת, בְּקָרַחְתּוֹ, אוֹ בְגַבַּחְתּוֹ--כְּמַרְאֵה צָרַעַת, עוֹר בָּשָׂר.
43.english: Then the priest shall look upon him; and, behold, if the rising of the plague be reddish-white in his bald head, or in his bald forehead, as the appearance of leprosy in the skin of the flesh,

44.hebrew: אִישׁ-צָרוּעַ הוּא, טָמֵא הוּא; טַמֵּא יְטַמְּאֶנּוּ הַכֹּהֵן, בְּרֹאשׁוֹ נִגְעוֹ.
44.english: he is a leprous man, he is unclean; the priest shall surely pronounce him unclean: his plague is in his head.

45.hebrew: וְהַצָּרוּעַ אֲשֶׁר-בּוֹ הַנֶּגַע, בְּגָדָיו יִהְיוּ פְרֻמִים וְרֹאשׁוֹ יִהְיֶה פָרוּעַ, וְעַל-שָׂפָם, יַעְטֶה; וְטָמֵא טָמֵא, יִקְרָא.
45.english: And the leper in whom the plague is, his clothes shall be rent, and the hair of his head shall go loose, and he shall cover his upper lip, and shall cry: 'Unclean, unclean.'

46.hebrew: כָּל-יְמֵי אֲשֶׁר הַנֶּגַע בּוֹ, יִטְמָא--טָמֵא הוּא:  בָּדָד יֵשֵׁב, מִחוּץ לַמַּחֲנֶה מוֹשָׁבוֹ.  {ס}
46.english: All the days wherein the plague is in him he shall be unclean; he is unclean; he shall dwell alone; without the camp shall his dwelling be. {S}

47.hebrew: וְהַבֶּגֶד, כִּי-יִהְיֶה בוֹ נֶגַע צָרָעַת:  בְּבֶגֶד צֶמֶר, אוֹ בְּבֶגֶד פִּשְׁתִּים.
47.english: And when the plague of leprosy is in a garment, whether it be a woolen garment, or a linen garment;

48.hebrew: אוֹ בִשְׁתִי אוֹ בְעֵרֶב, לַפִּשְׁתִּים וְלַצָּמֶר; אוֹ בְעוֹר, אוֹ בְּכָל-מְלֶאכֶת עוֹר.
48.english: or in the warp, or in the woof, whether they be of linen, or of wool; or in a skin, or in any thing made of skin.

49.hebrew: וְהָיָה הַנֶּגַע יְרַקְרַק אוֹ אֲדַמְדָּם, בַּבֶּגֶד אוֹ בָעוֹר אוֹ-בַשְּׁתִי אוֹ-בָעֵרֶב אוֹ בְכָל-כְּלִי-עוֹר--נֶגַע צָרַעַת, הוּא; וְהָרְאָה, אֶת-הַכֹּהֵן.
49.english: If the plague be greenish or reddish in the garment, or in the skin, or in the warp, or in the woof, or in any thing of skin, it is the plague of leprosy, and shall be shown unto the priest.

50.hebrew: וְרָאָה הַכֹּהֵן, אֶת-הַנָּגַע; וְהִסְגִּיר אֶת-הַנֶּגַע, שִׁבְעַת יָמִים.
50.english: And the priest shall look upon the plague, and shut up that which hath the plague seven days.

51.hebrew: וְרָאָה אֶת-הַנֶּגַע בַּיּוֹם הַשְּׁבִיעִי, כִּי-פָשָׂה הַנֶּגַע בַּבֶּגֶד אוֹ-בַשְּׁתִי אוֹ-בָעֵרֶב אוֹ בָעוֹר, לְכֹל אֲשֶׁר-יֵעָשֶׂה הָעוֹר, לִמְלָאכָה--צָרַעַת מַמְאֶרֶת הַנֶּגַע, טָמֵא הוּא.
51.english: And he shall look on the plague on the seventh day: if the plague be spread in the garment, or in the warp, or in the woof, or in the skin, whatever service skin is used for, the plague is a malignant leprosy: it is unclean.

52.hebrew: וְשָׂרַף אֶת-הַבֶּגֶד אוֹ אֶת-הַשְּׁתִי אוֹ אֶת-הָעֵרֶב, בַּצֶּמֶר אוֹ בַפִּשְׁתִּים, אוֹ אֶת-כָּל-כְּלִי הָעוֹר, אֲשֶׁר-יִהְיֶה בוֹ הַנָּגַע:  כִּי-צָרַעַת מַמְאֶרֶת הִוא, בָּאֵשׁ תִּשָּׂרֵף.
52.english: And he shall burn the garment, or the warp, or the woof, whether it be of wool or of linen, or any thing of skin, wherein the plague is; for it is a malignant leprosy; it shall be burnt in the fire.

53.hebrew: וְאִם, יִרְאֶה הַכֹּהֵן, וְהִנֵּה לֹא-פָשָׂה הַנֶּגַע, בַּבֶּגֶד אוֹ בַשְּׁתִי אוֹ בָעֵרֶב; אוֹ, בְּכָל-כְּלִי-עוֹר.
53.english: And if the priest shall look, and, behold, the plague be not spread in the garment, or in the warp, or in the woof, or in any thing of skin;

54.hebrew: וְצִוָּה, הַכֹּהֵן, וְכִבְּסוּ, אֵת אֲשֶׁר-בּוֹ הַנָּגַע; וְהִסְגִּירוֹ שִׁבְעַת-יָמִים, שֵׁנִית.
54.english: then the priest shall command that they wash the thing wherein the plague is, and he shall shut it up seven days more.

55.hebrew: וְרָאָה הַכֹּהֵן אַחֲרֵי הֻכַּבֵּס אֶת-הַנֶּגַע, וְהִנֵּה לֹא-הָפַךְ הַנֶּגַע אֶת-עֵינוֹ וְהַנֶּגַע לֹא-פָשָׂה--טָמֵא הוּא, בָּאֵשׁ תִּשְׂרְפֶנּוּ:  פְּחֶתֶת הִוא, בְּקָרַחְתּוֹ אוֹ בְגַבַּחְתּוֹ.
55.english: And the priest shall look, after that the plague is washed; and, behold, if the plague have not changed its colour, and the plague be not spread, it is unclean; thou shalt burn it in the fire; it is a fret, whether the bareness be within or without.

56.hebrew: וְאִם, רָאָה הַכֹּהֵן, וְהִנֵּה כֵּהָה הַנֶּגַע, אַחֲרֵי הֻכַּבֵּס אֹתוֹ--וְקָרַע אֹתוֹ, מִן-הַבֶּגֶד אוֹ מִן-הָעוֹר, אוֹ מִן-הַשְּׁתִי, אוֹ מִן-הָעֵרֶב.
56.english: And if the priest look, and, behold, the plague be dim after the washing thereof, then he shall rend it out of the garment, or out of the skin, or out of the warp, or out of the woof.

57.hebrew: וְאִם-תֵּרָאֶה עוֹד בַּבֶּגֶד אוֹ-בַשְּׁתִי אוֹ-בָעֵרֶב, אוֹ בְכָל-כְּלִי-עוֹר--פֹּרַחַת, הִוא:  בָּאֵשׁ תִּשְׂרְפֶנּוּ, אֵת אֲשֶׁר-בּוֹ הַנָּגַע.
57.english: And if it appear still in the garment, or in the warp, or in the woof, or in any thing of skin, it is breaking out, thou shalt burn that wherein the plague is with fire.

58.hebrew: וְהַבֶּגֶד אוֹ-הַשְּׁתִי אוֹ-הָעֵרֶב אוֹ-כָל-כְּלִי הָעוֹר, אֲשֶׁר תְּכַבֵּס, וְסָר מֵהֶם, הַנָּגַע--וְכֻבַּס שֵׁנִית, וְטָהֵר.
58.english: And the garment, or the warp, or the woof, or whatsoever thing of skin it be, which thou shalt wash, if the plague be departed from them, then it shall be washed the second time, and shall be clean.

59.hebrew: זֹאת תּוֹרַת נֶגַע-צָרַעַת בֶּגֶד הַצֶּמֶר אוֹ הַפִּשְׁתִּים, אוֹ הַשְּׁתִי אוֹ הָעֵרֶב, אוֹ, כָּל-כְּלִי-עוֹר--לְטַהֲרוֹ, אוֹ לְטַמְּאוֹ.  {פ}
59.english: This is the law of the plague of leprosy in a garment of wool or linen, or in the warp, or in the woof, or in any thing of skin, to pronounce it clean, or to pronounce it unclean. {P}

1.english: And the LORD spoke unto Moses, saying:

2.hebrew: זֹאת תִּהְיֶה תּוֹרַת הַמְּצֹרָע, בְּיוֹם טָהֳרָתוֹ:  וְהוּבָא, אֶל-הַכֹּהֵן.
2.english: This shall be the law of the leper in the day of his cleansing: he shall be brought unto the priest.

3.hebrew: וְיָצָא, הַכֹּהֵן, אֶל-מִחוּץ, לַמַּחֲנֶה; וְרָאָה, הַכֹּהֵן, וְהִנֵּה נִרְפָּא נֶגַע-הַצָּרַעַת, מִן-הַצָּרוּעַ.
3.english: And the priest shall go forth out of the camp; and the priest shall look, and, behold, if the plague of leprosy be healed in the leper;

4.hebrew: וְצִוָּה, הַכֹּהֵן, וְלָקַח לַמִּטַּהֵר שְׁתֵּי-צִפֳּרִים חַיּוֹת, טְהֹרוֹת; וְעֵץ אֶרֶז, וּשְׁנִי תוֹלַעַת וְאֵזֹב.
4.english: then shall the priest command to take for him that is to be cleansed two living clean birds, and cedar-wood, and scarlet, and hyssop.

5.hebrew: וְצִוָּה, הַכֹּהֵן, וְשָׁחַט, אֶת-הַצִּפּוֹר הָאֶחָת--אֶל-כְּלִי-חֶרֶשׂ, עַל-מַיִם חַיִּים.
5.english: And the priest shall command to kill one of the birds in an earthen vessel over running water.

6.hebrew: אֶת-הַצִּפֹּר הַחַיָּה יִקַּח אֹתָהּ, וְאֶת-עֵץ הָאֶרֶז וְאֶת-שְׁנִי הַתּוֹלַעַת וְאֶת-הָאֵזֹב; וְטָבַל אוֹתָם וְאֵת הַצִּפֹּר הַחַיָּה, בְּדַם הַצִּפֹּר הַשְּׁחֻטָה, עַל, הַמַּיִם הַחַיִּים.
6.english: As for the living bird, he shall take it, and the cedar-wood, and the scarlet, and the hyssop, and shall dip them and the living bird in the blood of the bird that was killed over the running water.

7.hebrew: וְהִזָּה, עַל הַמִּטַּהֵר מִן-הַצָּרַעַת--שֶׁבַע פְּעָמִים; וְטִהֲרוֹ, וְשִׁלַּח אֶת-הַצִּפֹּר הַחַיָּה עַל-פְּנֵי הַשָּׂדֶה.
7.english: And he shall sprinkle upon him that is to be cleansed from the leprosy seven times, and shall pronounce him clean, and shall let go the living bird into the open field.

8.hebrew: וְכִבֶּס הַמִּטַּהֵר אֶת-בְּגָדָיו וְגִלַּח אֶת-כָּל-שְׂעָרוֹ, וְרָחַץ בַּמַּיִם וְטָהֵר, וְאַחַר, יָבוֹא אֶל-הַמַּחֲנֶה; וְיָשַׁב מִחוּץ לְאָהֳלוֹ, שִׁבְעַת יָמִים.
8.english: And he that is to be cleansed shall wash his clothes, and shave off all his hair, and bathe himself in water, and he shall be clean; and after that he may come into the camp, but shall dwell outside his tent seven days.

9.hebrew: וְהָיָה בַיּוֹם הַשְּׁבִיעִי יְגַלַּח אֶת-כָּל-שְׂעָרוֹ, אֶת-רֹאשׁוֹ וְאֶת-זְקָנוֹ וְאֵת גַּבֹּת עֵינָיו, וְאֶת-כָּל-שְׂעָרוֹ, יְגַלֵּחַ; וְכִבֶּס אֶת-בְּגָדָיו, וְרָחַץ אֶת-בְּשָׂרוֹ בַּמַּיִם--וְטָהֵר.
9.english: And it shall be on the seventh day, that he shall shave all his hair off his head and his beard and his eyebrows, even all his hair he shall shave off; and he shall wash his clothes, and he shall bathe his flesh in water, and he shall be clean.

10.hebrew: וּבַיּוֹם הַשְּׁמִינִי, יִקַּח שְׁנֵי-כְבָשִׂים תְּמִימִם, וְכַבְשָׂה אַחַת בַּת-שְׁנָתָהּ, תְּמִימָה; וּשְׁלֹשָׁה עֶשְׂרֹנִים, סֹלֶת מִנְחָה בְּלוּלָה בַשֶּׁמֶן, וְלֹג אֶחָד, שָׁמֶן.
10.english: And on the eighth day he shall take two he-lambs without blemish, and one ewe-lamb of the first year without blemish, and three tenth parts of an ephah of fine flour for a meal-offering, mingled with oil, and one log of oil.

11.hebrew: וְהֶעֱמִיד הַכֹּהֵן הַמְטַהֵר, אֵת הָאִישׁ הַמִּטַּהֵר--וְאֹתָם:  לִפְנֵי יְהוָה, פֶּתַח אֹהֶל מוֹעֵד.
11.english: And the priest that cleanseth him shall set the man that is to be cleansed, and those things, before the LORD, at the door of the tent of meeting.

12.hebrew: וְלָקַח הַכֹּהֵן אֶת-הַכֶּבֶשׂ הָאֶחָד, וְהִקְרִיב אֹתוֹ לְאָשָׁם--וְאֶת-לֹג הַשָּׁמֶן; וְהֵנִיף אֹתָם תְּנוּפָה, לִפְנֵי יְהוָה.
12.english: And the priest shall take one of the he-lambs, and offer him for a guilt-offering, and the log of oil, and wave them for a wave-offering before the LORD.

13.hebrew: וְשָׁחַט אֶת-הַכֶּבֶשׂ, בִּמְקוֹם אֲשֶׁר יִשְׁחַט אֶת-הַחַטָּאת וְאֶת-הָעֹלָה--בִּמְקוֹם הַקֹּדֶשׁ:  כִּי כַּחַטָּאת הָאָשָׁם הוּא, לַכֹּהֵן--קֹדֶשׁ קָדָשִׁים, הוּא.
13.english: And he shall kill the he-lamb in the place where they kill the sin-offering and the burnt-offering, in the place of the sanctuary; for as the sin-offering is the priest's, so is the guilt-offering; it is most holy.

14.hebrew: וְלָקַח הַכֹּהֵן, מִדַּם הָאָשָׁם, וְנָתַן הַכֹּהֵן, עַל-תְּנוּךְ אֹזֶן הַמִּטַּהֵר הַיְמָנִית; וְעַל-בֹּהֶן יָדוֹ הַיְמָנִית, וְעַל-בֹּהֶן רַגְלוֹ הַיְמָנִית.
14.english: And the priest shall take of the blood of the guilt-offering, and the priest shall put it upon the tip of the right ear of him that is to be cleansed, and upon the thumb of his right hand, and upon the great toe of his right foot.

15.hebrew: וְלָקַח הַכֹּהֵן, מִלֹּג הַשָּׁמֶן; וְיָצַק עַל-כַּף הַכֹּהֵן, הַשְּׂמָאלִית.
15.english: And the priest shall take of the log of oil, and pour it into the palm of his own left hand.

16.hebrew: וְטָבַל הַכֹּהֵן, אֶת-אֶצְבָּעוֹ הַיְמָנִית, מִן-הַשֶּׁמֶן, אֲשֶׁר עַל-כַּפּוֹ הַשְּׂמָאלִית; וְהִזָּה מִן-הַשֶּׁמֶן בְּאֶצְבָּעוֹ שֶׁבַע פְּעָמִים, לִפְנֵי יְהוָה.
16.english: And the priest shall dip his right finger in the oil that is in his left hand, and shall sprinkle of the oil with his finger seven times before the LORD.

17.hebrew: וּמִיֶּתֶר הַשֶּׁמֶן אֲשֶׁר עַל-כַּפּוֹ, יִתֵּן הַכֹּהֵן עַל-תְּנוּךְ אֹזֶן הַמִּטַּהֵר הַיְמָנִית, וְעַל-בֹּהֶן יָדוֹ הַיְמָנִית, וְעַל-בֹּהֶן רַגְלוֹ הַיְמָנִית--עַל, דַּם הָאָשָׁם.
17.english: And of the rest of the oil that is in his hand shall the priest put upon the tip of the right ear of him that is to be cleansed, and upon the thumb of his right hand, and upon the great toe of his right foot, upon the blood of the guilt-offering.

18.hebrew: וְהַנּוֹתָר, בַּשֶּׁמֶן אֲשֶׁר עַל-כַּף הַכֹּהֵן, יִתֵּן, עַל-רֹאשׁ הַמִּטַּהֵר; וְכִפֶּר עָלָיו הַכֹּהֵן, לִפְנֵי יְהוָה.
18.english: And the rest of the oil that is in the priest's hand he shall put upon the head of him that is to be cleansed; and the priest shall make atonement for him before the LORD.

19.hebrew: וְעָשָׂה הַכֹּהֵן, אֶת-הַחַטָּאת, וְכִפֶּר, עַל-הַמִּטַּהֵר מִטֻּמְאָתוֹ; וְאַחַר, יִשְׁחַט אֶת-הָעֹלָה.
19.english: And the priest shall offer the sin-offering, and make atonement for him that is to be cleansed because of his uncleanness; and afterward he shall kill the burnt-offering.

20.hebrew: וְהֶעֱלָה הַכֹּהֵן אֶת-הָעֹלָה וְאֶת-הַמִּנְחָה, הַמִּזְבֵּחָה; וְכִפֶּר עָלָיו הַכֹּהֵן, וְטָהֵר.  {ס}
20.english: And the priest shall offer the burnt-offering and the meal-offering upon the altar; and the priest shall make atonement for him, and he shall be clean. {S}

21.hebrew: וְאִם-דַּל הוּא, וְאֵין יָדוֹ מַשֶּׂגֶת--וְלָקַח כֶּבֶשׂ אֶחָד אָשָׁם לִתְנוּפָה, לְכַפֵּר עָלָיו; וְעִשָּׂרוֹן סֹלֶת אֶחָד בָּלוּל בַּשֶּׁמֶן, לְמִנְחָה--וְלֹג שָׁמֶן.
21.english: And if he be poor, and his means suffice not, then he shall take one he-lamb for a guilt-offering to be waved, to make atonement for him, and one tenth part of an ephah of fine flour mingled with oil for a meal-offering, and a log of oil;

22.hebrew: וּשְׁתֵּי תֹרִים, אוֹ שְׁנֵי בְּנֵי יוֹנָה, אֲשֶׁר תַּשִּׂיג, יָדוֹ; וְהָיָה אֶחָד חַטָּאת, וְהָאֶחָד עֹלָה.
22.english: and two turtle-doves, or two young pigeons, such as his means suffice for; and the one shall be a sin-offering, and the other a burnt-offering.

23.hebrew: וְהֵבִיא אֹתָם בַּיּוֹם הַשְּׁמִינִי, לְטָהֳרָתוֹ--אֶל-הַכֹּהֵן:  אֶל-פֶּתַח אֹהֶל-מוֹעֵד, לִפְנֵי יְהוָה.
23.english: And on the eighth day he shall bring them for his cleansing unto the priest, unto the door of the tent of meeting, before the LORD.

24.hebrew: וְלָקַח הַכֹּהֵן אֶת-כֶּבֶשׂ הָאָשָׁם, וְאֶת-לֹג הַשָּׁמֶן; וְהֵנִיף אֹתָם הַכֹּהֵן תְּנוּפָה, לִפְנֵי יְהוָה.
24.english: And the priest shall take the lamb of the guilt-offering, and the log of oil, and the priest shall wave them for a wave-offering before the LORD.

25.hebrew: וְשָׁחַט, אֶת-כֶּבֶשׂ הָאָשָׁם, וְלָקַח הַכֹּהֵן מִדַּם הָאָשָׁם, וְנָתַן עַל-תְּנוּךְ אֹזֶן-הַמִּטַּהֵר הַיְמָנִית; וְעַל-בֹּהֶן יָדוֹ הַיְמָנִית, וְעַל-בֹּהֶן רַגְלוֹ הַיְמָנִית.
25.english: And he shall kill the lamb of the guilt-offering, and the priest shall take of the blood of the guilt-offering, and put it upon the tip of the right ear of him that is to be cleansed, and upon the thumb of his right hand, and upon the great toe of his right foot.

26.hebrew: וּמִן-הַשֶּׁמֶן, יִצֹק הַכֹּהֵן, עַל-כַּף הַכֹּהֵן, הַשְּׂמָאלִית.
26.english: And the priest shall pour of the oil into the palm of his own left hand.

27.hebrew: וְהִזָּה הַכֹּהֵן, בְּאֶצְבָּעוֹ הַיְמָנִית, מִן-הַשֶּׁמֶן, אֲשֶׁר עַל-כַּפּוֹ הַשְּׂמָאלִית--שֶׁבַע פְּעָמִים, לִפְנֵי יְהוָה.
27.english: And the priest shall sprinkle with his right finger some of the oil that is in his left hand seven times before the LORD.

28.hebrew: וְנָתַן הַכֹּהֵן מִן-הַשֶּׁמֶן אֲשֶׁר עַל-כַּפּוֹ, עַל-תְּנוּךְ אֹזֶן הַמִּטַּהֵר הַיְמָנִית, וְעַל-בֹּהֶן יָדוֹ הַיְמָנִית, וְעַל-בֹּהֶן רַגְלוֹ הַיְמָנִית--עַל-מְקוֹם, דַּם הָאָשָׁם.
28.english: And the priest shall put of the oil that is in his hand upon the tip of the right ear of him that is to be cleansed, and upon the thumb of his right hand, and upon the great toe of his right foot, upon the place of the blood of the guilt-offering.

29.hebrew: וְהַנּוֹתָר, מִן-הַשֶּׁמֶן אֲשֶׁר עַל-כַּף הַכֹּהֵן, יִתֵּן, עַל-רֹאשׁ הַמִּטַּהֵר--לְכַפֵּר עָלָיו, לִפְנֵי יְהוָה.
29.english: And the rest of the oil that is in the priest's hand he shall put upon the head of him that is to be cleansed, to make atonement for him before the LORD.

30.hebrew: וְעָשָׂה אֶת-הָאֶחָד מִן-הַתֹּרִים, אוֹ מִן-בְּנֵי הַיּוֹנָה, מֵאֲשֶׁר תַּשִּׂיג, יָדוֹ.
30.english: And he shall offer one of the turtle-doves, or of the young pigeons, such as his means suffice for;

31.hebrew: אֵת אֲשֶׁר-תַּשִּׂיג יָדוֹ, אֶת-הָאֶחָד חַטָּאת וְאֶת-הָאֶחָד עֹלָה--עַל-הַמִּנְחָה; וְכִפֶּר הַכֹּהֵן עַל הַמִּטַּהֵר, לִפְנֵי יְהוָה.
31.english: even such as his means suffice for, the one for a sin-offering, and the other for a burnt-offering, with the meal-offering; and the priest shall make atonement for him that is to be cleansed before the LORD.

32.hebrew: זֹאת תּוֹרַת, אֲשֶׁר-בּוֹ נֶגַע צָרָעַת, אֲשֶׁר לֹא-תַשִּׂיג יָדוֹ, בְּטָהֳרָתוֹ.  {פ}
32.english: This is the law of him in whom is the plague of leprosy, whose means suffice not for that which pertaineth to his cleansing. {P}

33.english: And the LORD spoke unto Moses and unto Aaron, saying:

34.hebrew: כִּי תָבֹאוּ אֶל-אֶרֶץ כְּנַעַן, אֲשֶׁר אֲנִי נֹתֵן לָכֶם לַאֲחֻזָּה; וְנָתַתִּי נֶגַע צָרַעַת, בְּבֵית אֶרֶץ אֲחֻזַּתְכֶם.
34.english: When ye are come into the land of Canaan, which I give to you for a possession, and I put the plague of leprosy in a house of the land of your possession;

35.hebrew: וּבָא אֲשֶׁר-לוֹ הַבַּיִת, וְהִגִּיד לַכֹּהֵן לֵאמֹר:  כְּנֶגַע, נִרְאָה לִי בַּבָּיִת.
35.english: then he that owneth the house shall come and tell the priest, saying: 'There seemeth to me to be as it were a plague in the house.'

36.hebrew: וְצִוָּה הַכֹּהֵן וּפִנּוּ אֶת-הַבַּיִת, בְּטֶרֶם יָבֹא הַכֹּהֵן לִרְאוֹת אֶת-הַנֶּגַע, וְלֹא יִטְמָא, כָּל-אֲשֶׁר בַּבָּיִת; וְאַחַר כֵּן יָבֹא הַכֹּהֵן, לִרְאוֹת אֶת-הַבָּיִת.
36.english: And the priest shall command that they empty the house, before the priest go in to see the plague, that all that is in the house be not made unclean; and afterward the priest shall go in to see the house.

37.hebrew: וְרָאָה אֶת-הַנֶּגַע, וְהִנֵּה הַנֶּגַע בְּקִירֹת הַבַּיִת, שְׁקַעֲרוּרֹת יְרַקְרַקֹּת, אוֹ אֲדַמְדַּמֹּת; וּמַרְאֵיהֶן שָׁפָל, מִן-הַקִּיר.
37.english: And he shall look on the plague, and, behold, if the plague be in the walls of the house with hollow streaks, greenish or reddish, and the appearance thereof be lower than the wall;

38.hebrew: וְיָצָא הַכֹּהֵן מִן-הַבַּיִת, אֶל-פֶּתַח הַבָּיִת; וְהִסְגִּיר אֶת-הַבַּיִת, שִׁבְעַת יָמִים.
38.english: then the priest shall go out of the house to the door of the house, and shut up the house seven days.

39.hebrew: וְשָׁב הַכֹּהֵן, בַּיּוֹם הַשְּׁבִיעִי; וְרָאָה, וְהִנֵּה פָּשָׂה הַנֶּגַע בְּקִירֹת הַבָּיִת.
39.english: And the priest shall come again the seventh day, and shall look; and, behold, if the plague be spread in the walls of the house;

40.hebrew: וְצִוָּה, הַכֹּהֵן, וְחִלְּצוּ אֶת-הָאֲבָנִים, אֲשֶׁר בָּהֵן הַנָּגַע; וְהִשְׁלִיכוּ אֶתְהֶן אֶל-מִחוּץ לָעִיר, אֶל-מָקוֹם טָמֵא.
40.english: then the priest shall command that they take out the stones in which the plague is, and cast them into an unclean place without the city.

41.hebrew: וְאֶת-הַבַּיִת יַקְצִעַ מִבַּיִת, סָבִיב; וְשָׁפְכוּ, אֶת-הֶעָפָר אֲשֶׁר הִקְצוּ, אֶל-מִחוּץ לָעִיר, אֶל-מָקוֹם טָמֵא.
41.english: And he shall cause the house to be scraped within round about, and they shall pour out the mortar that they scrape off without the city into an unclean place.

42.hebrew: וְלָקְחוּ אֲבָנִים אֲחֵרוֹת, וְהֵבִיאוּ אֶל-תַּחַת הָאֲבָנִים; וְעָפָר אַחֵר יִקַּח, וְטָח אֶת-הַבָּיִת.
42.english: And they shall take other stones, and put them in the place of those stones; and he shall take other mortar, and shall plaster the house.

43.hebrew: וְאִם-יָשׁוּב הַנֶּגַע וּפָרַח בַּבַּיִת, אַחַר חִלֵּץ אֶת-הָאֲבָנִים, וְאַחֲרֵי הִקְצוֹת אֶת-הַבַּיִת, וְאַחֲרֵי הִטּוֹחַ.
43.english: And if the plague come again, and break out in the house, after that the stones have been taken out, and after the house hath been scraped, and after it is plastered;

44.hebrew: וּבָא, הַכֹּהֵן, וְרָאָה, וְהִנֵּה פָּשָׂה הַנֶּגַע בַּבָּיִת--צָרַעַת מַמְאֶרֶת הִוא בַּבַּיִת, טָמֵא הוּא.
44.english: then the priest shall come in and look; and, behold, if the plague be spread in the house, it is a malignant leprosy in the house: it is unclean.

45.hebrew: וְנָתַץ אֶת-הַבַּיִת, אֶת-אֲבָנָיו וְאֶת-עֵצָיו, וְאֵת, כָּל-עֲפַר הַבָּיִת; וְהוֹצִיא אֶל-מִחוּץ לָעִיר, אֶל-מָקוֹם טָמֵא.
45.english: And he shall break down the house, the stones of it, and the timber thereof, and all the mortar of the house; and he shall carry them forth out of the city into an unclean place.

46.hebrew: וְהַבָּא, אֶל-הַבַּיִת, כָּל-יְמֵי, הִסְגִּיר אֹתוֹ--יִטְמָא, עַד-הָעָרֶב.
46.english: Moreover he that goeth into the house all the while that it is shut up shall be unclean until the even.

47.hebrew: וְהַשֹּׁכֵב בַּבַּיִת, יְכַבֵּס אֶת-בְּגָדָיו; וְהָאֹכֵל בַּבַּיִת, יְכַבֵּס אֶת-בְּגָדָיו.
47.english: And he that lieth in the house shall wash his clothes; and he that eateth in the house shall wash his clothes.

48.hebrew: וְאִם-בֹּא יָבֹא הַכֹּהֵן, וְרָאָה וְהִנֵּה לֹא-פָשָׂה הַנֶּגַע בַּבַּיִת, אַחֲרֵי, הִטֹּחַ אֶת-הַבָּיִת--וְטִהַר הַכֹּהֵן אֶת-הַבַּיִת, כִּי נִרְפָּא הַנָּגַע.
48.english: And if the priest shall come in, and look, and, behold, the plague hath not spread in the house, after the house was plastered; then the priest shall pronounce the house clean, because the plague is healed.

49.hebrew: וְלָקַח לְחַטֵּא אֶת-הַבַּיִת, שְׁתֵּי צִפֳּרִים, וְעֵץ אֶרֶז, וּשְׁנִי תוֹלַעַת וְאֵזֹב.
49.english: And he shall take to cleanse the house two birds, and cedar-wood, and scarlet, and hyssop.

50.hebrew: וְשָׁחַט, אֶת-הַצִּפֹּר הָאֶחָת, אֶל-כְּלִי-חֶרֶשׂ, עַל-מַיִם חַיִּים.
50.english: And he shall kill one of the birds in an earthen vessel over running water.

51.hebrew: וְלָקַח אֶת-עֵץ-הָאֶרֶז וְאֶת-הָאֵזֹב וְאֵת שְׁנִי הַתּוֹלַעַת, וְאֵת הַצִּפֹּר הַחַיָּה, וְטָבַל אֹתָם בְּדַם הַצִּפֹּר הַשְּׁחוּטָה, וּבַמַּיִם הַחַיִּים; וְהִזָּה אֶל-הַבַּיִת, שֶׁבַע פְּעָמִים.
51.english: And he shall take the cedar-wood, and the hyssop, and the scarlet, and the living bird, and dip them in the blood of the slain bird, and in the running water, and sprinkle the house seven times.

52.hebrew: וְחִטֵּא אֶת-הַבַּיִת--בְּדַם הַצִּפּוֹר, וּבַמַּיִם הַחַיִּים; וּבַצִּפֹּר הַחַיָּה, וּבְעֵץ הָאֶרֶז וּבָאֵזֹב--וּבִשְׁנִי הַתּוֹלָעַת.
52.english: And he shall cleanse the house with the blood of the bird, and with the running water, and with the living bird, and with the cedar-wood, and with the hyssop, and with the scarlet.

53.hebrew: וְשִׁלַּח אֶת-הַצִּפֹּר הַחַיָּה, אֶל-מִחוּץ לָעִיר--אֶל-פְּנֵי הַשָּׂדֶה; וְכִפֶּר עַל-הַבַּיִת, וְטָהֵר.
53.english: But he shall let go the living bird out of the city into the open field; so shall he make atonement for the house; and it shall be clean.

54.english: This is the law for all manner of plague of leprosy, and for a scall;

55.english: and for the leprosy of a garment, and for a house;

56.english: and for a rising, and for a scab, and for a bright spot;

57.hebrew: לְהוֹרֹת, בְּיוֹם הַטָּמֵא וּבְיוֹם הַטָּהֹר; זֹאת תּוֹרַת, הַצָּרָעַת.  {פ}
57.english: to teach when it is unclean, and when it is clean; this is the law of leprosy. {P}

1.english: And the LORD spoke unto Moses and to Aaron, saying:

2.hebrew: דַּבְּרוּ אֶל-בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל, וַאֲמַרְתֶּם אֲלֵהֶם:  אִישׁ אִישׁ, כִּי יִהְיֶה זָב מִבְּשָׂרוֹ--זוֹבוֹ, טָמֵא הוּא.
2.english: Speak unto the children of Israel, and say unto them: When any man hath an issue out of his flesh, his issue is unclean.

3.hebrew: וְזֹאת תִּהְיֶה טֻמְאָתוֹ, בְּזוֹבוֹ:  רָר בְּשָׂרוֹ אֶת-זוֹבוֹ, אוֹ-הֶחְתִּים בְּשָׂרוֹ מִזּוֹבוֹ--טֻמְאָתוֹ, הִוא.
3.english: And this shall be his uncleanness in his issue: whether his flesh run with his issue, or his flesh be stopped from his issue, it is his uncleanness.

4.hebrew: כָּל-הַמִּשְׁכָּב, אֲשֶׁר יִשְׁכַּב עָלָיו הַזָּב--יִטְמָא; וְכָל-הַכְּלִי אֲשֶׁר-יֵשֵׁב עָלָיו, יִטְמָא.
4.english: Every bed whereon he that hath the issue lieth shall be unclean; and every thing whereon he sitteth shall be unclean.

5.hebrew: וְאִישׁ, אֲשֶׁר יִגַּע בְּמִשְׁכָּבוֹ--יְכַבֵּס בְּגָדָיו וְרָחַץ בַּמַּיִם, וְטָמֵא עַד-הָעָרֶב.
5.english: And whosoever toucheth his bed shall wash his clothes, and bathe himself in water, and be unclean until the even.

6.hebrew: וְהַיֹּשֵׁב, עַל-הַכְּלִי, אֲשֶׁר-יֵשֵׁב עָלָיו, הַזָּב--יְכַבֵּס בְּגָדָיו וְרָחַץ בַּמַּיִם, וְטָמֵא עַד-הָעָרֶב.
6.english: And he that sitteth on any thing whereon he that hath the issue sat shall wash his clothes, and bathe himself in water, and be unclean until the even.

7.hebrew: וְהַנֹּגֵעַ, בִּבְשַׂר הַזָּב--יְכַבֵּס בְּגָדָיו וְרָחַץ בַּמַּיִם, וְטָמֵא עַד-הָעָרֶב.
7.english: And he that toucheth the flesh of him that hath the issue shall wash his clothes, and bathe himself in water, and be unclean until the even.

8.hebrew: וְכִי-יָרֹק הַזָּב, בַּטָּהוֹר--וְכִבֶּס בְּגָדָיו וְרָחַץ בַּמַּיִם, וְטָמֵא עַד-הָעָרֶב.
8.english: And if he that hath the issue spit upon him that is clean, then he shall wash his clothes, and bathe himself in water, and be unclean until the even.

9.hebrew: וְכָל-הַמֶּרְכָּב, אֲשֶׁר יִרְכַּב עָלָיו הַזָּב--יִטְמָא.
9.english: And what saddle soever he that hath the issue rideth upon shall be unclean.

10.hebrew: וְכָל-הַנֹּגֵעַ, בְּכֹל אֲשֶׁר יִהְיֶה תַחְתָּיו--יִטְמָא, עַד-הָעָרֶב; וְהַנּוֹשֵׂא אוֹתָם--יְכַבֵּס בְּגָדָיו וְרָחַץ בַּמַּיִם, וְטָמֵא עַד-הָעָרֶב.
10.english: And whosoever toucheth any thing that was under him shall be unclean until the even; and he that beareth those things shall wash his clothes, and bathe himself in water, and be unclean until the even.

11.hebrew: וְכֹל אֲשֶׁר יִגַּע-בּוֹ הַזָּב, וְיָדָיו לֹא-שָׁטַף בַּמָּיִם--וְכִבֶּס בְּגָדָיו וְרָחַץ בַּמַּיִם, וְטָמֵא עַד-הָעָרֶב.
11.english: And whomsoever he that hath the issue toucheth, without having rinsed his hands in water, he shall wash his clothes, and bathe himself in water, and be unclean until the even.

12.hebrew: וּכְלִי-חֶרֶשׂ אֲשֶׁר-יִגַּע-בּוֹ הַזָּב, יִשָּׁבֵר; וְכָל-כְּלִי-עֵץ--יִשָּׁטֵף, בַּמָּיִם.
12.english: And the earthen vessel, which he that hath the issue toucheth, shall be broken; and every vessel of wood shall be rinsed in water.

13.hebrew: וְכִי-יִטְהַר הַזָּב, מִזּוֹבוֹ--וְסָפַר לוֹ שִׁבְעַת יָמִים לְטָהֳרָתוֹ, וְכִבֶּס בְּגָדָיו; וְרָחַץ בְּשָׂרוֹ בְּמַיִם חַיִּים, וְטָהֵר.
13.english: And when he that hath an issue is cleansed of his issue, then he shall number to himself seven days for his cleansing, and wash his clothes; and he shall bathe his flesh in running water, and shall be clean.

14.hebrew: וּבַיּוֹם הַשְּׁמִינִי, יִקַּח-לוֹ שְׁתֵּי תֹרִים, אוֹ שְׁנֵי, בְּנֵי יוֹנָה; וּבָא לִפְנֵי יְהוָה, אֶל-פֶּתַח אֹהֶל מוֹעֵד, וּנְתָנָם, אֶל-הַכֹּהֵן.
14.english: And on the eighth day he shall take to him two turtle-doves, or two young pigeons, and come before the LORD unto the door of the tent of meeting, and give them unto the priest.

15.hebrew: וְעָשָׂה אֹתָם, הַכֹּהֵן--אֶחָד חַטָּאת, וְהָאֶחָד עֹלָה; וְכִפֶּר עָלָיו הַכֹּהֵן לִפְנֵי יְהוָה, מִזּוֹבוֹ.  {ס}
15.english: And the priest shall offer them, the one for a sin-offering, and the other for a burnt-offering; and the priest shall make atonement for him before the LORD for his issue. {S}

16.hebrew: וְאִישׁ, כִּי-תֵצֵא מִמֶּנּוּ שִׁכְבַת-זָרַע--וְרָחַץ בַּמַּיִם אֶת-כָּל-בְּשָׂרוֹ, וְטָמֵא עַד-הָעָרֶב.
16.english: And if the flow of seed go out from a man, then he shall bathe all his flesh in water, and be unclean until the even.

17.hebrew: וְכָל-בֶּגֶד וְכָל-עוֹר, אֲשֶׁר-יִהְיֶה עָלָיו שִׁכְבַת-זָרַע--וְכֻבַּס בַּמַּיִם, וְטָמֵא עַד-הָעָרֶב.
17.english: And every garment, and every skin, whereon is the flow of seed, shall be washed with water, and be unclean until the even.

18.hebrew: וְאִשָּׁה, אֲשֶׁר יִשְׁכַּב אִישׁ אֹתָהּ שִׁכְבַת-זָרַע--וְרָחֲצוּ בַמַּיִם, וְטָמְאוּ עַד-הָעָרֶב.  {פ}
18.english: The woman also with whom a man shall lie carnally, they shall both bathe themselves in water, and be unclean until the even. {P}

19.hebrew: וְאִשָּׁה כִּי-תִהְיֶה זָבָה, דָּם יִהְיֶה זֹבָהּ בִּבְשָׂרָהּ--שִׁבְעַת יָמִים תִּהְיֶה בְנִדָּתָהּ, וְכָל-הַנֹּגֵעַ בָּהּ יִטְמָא עַד-הָעָרֶב.
19.english: And if a woman have an issue, and her issue in her flesh be blood, she shall be in her impurity seven days; and whosoever toucheth her shall be unclean until the even.

20.hebrew: וְכֹל אֲשֶׁר תִּשְׁכַּב עָלָיו בְּנִדָּתָהּ, יִטְמָא; וְכֹל אֲשֶׁר-תֵּשֵׁב עָלָיו, יִטְמָא.
20.english: And every thing that she lieth upon in her impurity shall be unclean; every thing also that she sitteth upon shall be unclean.

21.hebrew: וְכָל-הַנֹּגֵעַ, בְּמִשְׁכָּבָהּ--יְכַבֵּס בְּגָדָיו וְרָחַץ בַּמַּיִם, וְטָמֵא עַד-הָעָרֶב.
21.english: And whosoever toucheth her bed shall wash his clothes, and bathe himself in water, and be unclean until the even.

22.hebrew: וְכָל-הַנֹּגֵעַ--בְּכָל-כְּלִי, אֲשֶׁר-תֵּשֵׁב עָלָיו:  יְכַבֵּס בְּגָדָיו וְרָחַץ בַּמַּיִם, וְטָמֵא עַד-הָעָרֶב.
22.english: And whosoever toucheth any thing that she sitteth upon shall wash his clothes, and bathe himself in water, and be unclean until the even.

23.hebrew: וְאִם עַל-הַמִּשְׁכָּב הוּא, אוֹ עַל-הַכְּלִי אֲשֶׁר-הִוא יֹשֶׁבֶת-עָלָיו--בְּנָגְעוֹ-בוֹ:  יִטְמָא, עַד-הָעָרֶב.
23.english: And if he be on the bed, or on any thing whereon she sitteth, when he toucheth it, he shall be unclean until the even.

24.hebrew: וְאִם שָׁכֹב יִשְׁכַּב אִישׁ אֹתָהּ, וּתְהִי נִדָּתָהּ עָלָיו--וְטָמֵא, שִׁבְעַת יָמִים; וְכָל-הַמִּשְׁכָּב אֲשֶׁר-יִשְׁכַּב עָלָיו, יִטְמָא.  {ס}
24.english: And if any man lie with her, and her impurity be upon him, he shall be unclean seven days; and every bed whereon he lieth shall be unclean. {S}

25.hebrew: וְאִשָּׁה כִּי-יָזוּב זוֹב דָּמָהּ יָמִים רַבִּים, בְּלֹא עֶת-נִדָּתָהּ, אוֹ כִי-תָזוּב, עַל-נִדָּתָהּ:  כָּל-יְמֵי זוֹב טֻמְאָתָהּ, כִּימֵי נִדָּתָהּ תִּהְיֶה--טְמֵאָה הִוא.
25.english: And if a woman have an issue of her blood many days not in the time of her impurity, or if she have an issue beyond the time of her impurity; all the days of the issue of her uncleanness she shall be as in the days of her impurity: she is unclean.

26.hebrew: כָּל-הַמִּשְׁכָּב אֲשֶׁר-תִּשְׁכַּב עָלָיו, כָּל-יְמֵי זוֹבָהּ--כְּמִשְׁכַּב נִדָּתָהּ, יִהְיֶה-לָּהּ; וְכָל-הַכְּלִי, אֲשֶׁר תֵּשֵׁב עָלָיו--טָמֵא יִהְיֶה, כְּטֻמְאַת נִדָּתָהּ.
26.english: Every bed whereon she lieth all the days of her issue shall be unto her as the bed of her impurity; and every thing whereon she sitteth shall be unclean, as the uncleanness of her impurity.

27.hebrew: וְכָל-הַנּוֹגֵעַ בָּם, יִטְמָא; וְכִבֶּס בְּגָדָיו וְרָחַץ בַּמַּיִם, וְטָמֵא עַד-הָעָרֶב.
27.english: And whosoever toucheth those things shall be unclean, and shall wash his clothes, and bathe himself in water, and be unclean until the even.

28.hebrew: וְאִם-טָהֲרָה, מִזּוֹבָהּ--וְסָפְרָה לָּהּ שִׁבְעַת יָמִים, וְאַחַר תִּטְהָר.
28.english: But if she be cleansed of her issue, then she shall number to herself seven days, and after that she shall be clean.

29.hebrew: וּבַיּוֹם הַשְּׁמִינִי, תִּקַּח-לָהּ שְׁתֵּי תֹרִים, אוֹ שְׁנֵי, בְּנֵי יוֹנָה; וְהֵבִיאָה אוֹתָם אֶל-הַכֹּהֵן, אֶל-פֶּתַח אֹהֶל מוֹעֵד.
29.english: And on the eighth day she shall take unto her two turtle-doves, or two young pigeons, and bring them unto the priest, to the door of the tent of meeting.

30.hebrew: וְעָשָׂה הַכֹּהֵן אֶת-הָאֶחָד חַטָּאת, וְאֶת-הָאֶחָד עֹלָה; וְכִפֶּר עָלֶיהָ הַכֹּהֵן לִפְנֵי יְהוָה, מִזּוֹב טֻמְאָתָהּ.
30.english: And the priest shall offer the one for a sin-offering, and the other for a burnt-offering; and the priest shall make atonement for her before the LORD for the issue of her uncleanness.

31.hebrew: וְהִזַּרְתֶּם אֶת-בְּנֵי-יִשְׂרָאֵל, מִטֻּמְאָתָם; וְלֹא יָמֻתוּ בְּטֻמְאָתָם, בְּטַמְּאָם אֶת-מִשְׁכָּנִי אֲשֶׁר בְּתוֹכָם.
31.english: Thus shall ye separate the children of Israel from their uncleanness; that they die not in their uncleanness, when they defile My tabernacle that is in the midst of them.

32.hebrew: זֹאת תּוֹרַת, הַזָּב, וַאֲשֶׁר תֵּצֵא מִמֶּנּוּ שִׁכְבַת-זֶרַע, לְטָמְאָה-בָהּ.
32.english: This is the law of him that hath an issue, and of him from whom the flow of seed goeth out, so that he is unclean thereby;

33.hebrew: וְהַדָּוָה, בְּנִדָּתָהּ, וְהַזָּב אֶת-זוֹבוֹ, לַזָּכָר וְלַנְּקֵבָה; וּלְאִישׁ, אֲשֶׁר יִשְׁכַּב עִם-טְמֵאָה.  {פ}
33.english: and of her that is sick with her impurity, and of them that have an issue, whether it be a man, or a woman; and of him that lieth with her that is unclean. {P}

10.english: And whatsoever man there be of the house of Israel, or of the strangers that sojourn among them, that eateth any manner of blood, I will set My face against that soul that eateth blood, and will cut him off from among his people.

1.english: And the LORD spoke unto Moses, saying:

2.hebrew: åÀàÆì-áÌÀğÅé éÄùÒÀøÈàÅì, úÌÉàîÇø, àÄéùÑ àÄéùÑ îÄáÌÀğÅé éÄùÒÀøÈàÅì åÌîÄï-äÇâÌÅø äÇâÌÈø áÌÀéÄùÒÀøÈàÅì àÂùÑÆø éÄúÌÅï îÄæÌÇøÀòåÉ ìÇîÌÉìÆêÀ, îåÉú éåÌîÈú; òÇí äÈàÈøÆõ, éÄøÀâÌÀîËäåÌ áÈàÈáÆï.
2.english: Moreover, thou shalt say to the children of Israel: Whosoever he be of the children of Israel, or of the strangers that sojourn in Israel, that giveth of his seed unto Molech; he shall surely be put to death; the people of the land shall stone him with stones.

3.hebrew: åÇàÂğÄé àÆúÌÅï àÆú-ôÌÈğÇé, áÌÈàÄéùÑ äÇäåÌà, åÀäÄëÀøÇúÌÄé àÉúåÉ, îÄ÷ÌÆøÆá òÇîÌåÉ:  ëÌÄé îÄæÌÇøÀòåÉ, ğÈúÇï ìÇîÌÉìÆêÀ--ìÀîÇòÇï èÇîÌÅà àÆú-îÄ÷ÀãÌÈùÑÄé, åÌìÀçÇìÌÅì àÆú-ùÑÅí ÷ÈãÀùÑÄé.
3.english: I also will set My face against that man, and will cut him off from among his people, because he hath given of his seed unto Molech, to defile My sanctuary, and to profane My holy name.

4.hebrew: åÀàÄí äÇòÀìÅí éÇòÀìÄéîåÌ òÇí äÈàÈøÆõ àÆú-òÅéğÅéäÆí, îÄï-äÈàÄéùÑ äÇäåÌà, áÌÀúÄúÌåÉ îÄæÌÇøÀòåÉ, ìÇîÌÉìÆêÀ--ìÀáÄìÀúÌÄé, äÈîÄéú àÉúåÉ.
4.english: And if the people of the land do at all hide their eyes from that man, when he giveth of his seed unto Molech, and put him not to death;

5.hebrew: åÀùÒÇîÀúÌÄé àÂğÄé àÆú-ôÌÈğÇé áÌÈàÄéùÑ äÇäåÌà, åÌáÀîÄùÑÀôÌÇçÀúÌåÉ; åÀäÄëÀøÇúÌÄé àÉúåÉ åÀàÅú ëÌÈì-äÇæÌÉğÄéí àÇçÂøÈéå, ìÄæÀğåÉú àÇçÂøÅé äÇîÌÉìÆêÀ--îÄ÷ÌÆøÆá òÇîÌÈí.

6.hebrew: åÀäÇğÌÆôÆùÑ, àÂùÑÆø úÌÄôÀğÆä àÆì-äÈàÉáÉú åÀàÆì-äÇéÌÄãÌÀòÉğÄéí, ìÄæÀğÉú, àÇçÂøÅéäÆí--åÀğÈúÇúÌÄé àÆú-ôÌÈğÇé áÌÇğÌÆôÆùÑ äÇäÄåà, åÀäÄëÀøÇúÌÄé àÉúåÉ îÄ÷ÌÆøÆá òÇîÌåÉ.
6.english: And the soul that turneth unto the ghosts, and unto the familiar spirits, to go astray after them, I will even set My face against that soul, and will cut him off from among his people.

7.hebrew: åÀäÄúÀ÷ÇãÌÄùÑÀúÌÆí--åÄäÀéÄéúÆí, ÷ÀãÉùÑÄéí:  ëÌÄé àÂğÄé éÀäåÈä, àÁìÉäÅéëÆí.
7.english: Sanctify yourselves therefore, and be ye holy; for I am the LORD your God.

8.hebrew: åÌùÑÀîÇøÀúÌÆí, àÆú-çË÷ÌÉúÇé, åÇòÂùÒÄéúÆí, àÉúÈí:  àÂğÄé éÀäåÈä, îÀ÷ÇãÌÄùÑÀëÆí.

9.hebrew: ëÌÄé-àÄéùÑ àÄéùÑ, àÂùÑÆø éÀ÷ÇìÌÅì àÆú-àÈáÄéå åÀàÆú-àÄîÌåÉ--îåÉú éåÌîÈú:  àÈáÄéå åÀàÄîÌåÉ ÷ÄìÌÅì, ãÌÈîÈéå áÌåÉ.

10.hebrew: åÀàÄéùÑ, àÂùÑÆø éÄğÀàÇó àÆú-àÅùÑÆú àÄéùÑ, àÂùÑÆø éÄğÀàÇó, àÆú-àÅùÑÆú øÅòÅäåÌ--îåÉú-éåÌîÇú äÇğÌÉàÅó, åÀäÇğÌÉàÈôÆú.

14.hebrew: åÀàÄéùÑ, àÂùÑÆø éÄ÷ÌÇç àÆú-àÄùÌÑÈä åÀàÆú-àÄîÌÈäÌ--æÄîÌÈä äÄåà; áÌÈàÅùÑ éÄùÒÀøÀôåÌ àÉúåÉ, åÀàÆúÀäÆï, åÀìÉà-úÄäÀéÆä æÄîÌÈä, áÌÀúåÉëÀëÆí.

15.hebrew: åÀàÄéùÑ, àÂùÑÆø éÄúÌÅï ùÑÀëÈáÀúÌåÉ áÌÄáÀäÅîÈä--îåÉú éåÌîÈú; åÀàÆú-äÇáÌÀäÅîÈä, úÌÇäÂøÉâåÌ.

16.hebrew: åÀàÄùÌÑÈä, àÂùÑÆø úÌÄ÷ÀøÇá àÆì-ëÌÈì-áÌÀäÅîÈä ìÀøÄáÀòÈä àÉúÈäÌ--åÀäÈøÇâÀúÌÈ àÆú-äÈàÄùÌÑÈä, åÀàÆú-äÇáÌÀäÅîÈä; îåÉú éåÌîÈúåÌ, ãÌÀîÅéäÆí áÌÈí.
16.english: And if a woman approach unto any beast, and lie down thereto, thou shalt kill the woman, and the beast: they shall surely be put to death; their blood shall be upon them.

17.hebrew: åÀàÄéùÑ àÂùÑÆø-éÄ÷ÌÇç àÆú-àÂçÉúåÉ áÌÇú-àÈáÄéå àåÉ áÇú-àÄîÌåÉ åÀøÈàÈä àÆú-òÆøÀåÈúÈäÌ åÀäÄéà-úÄøÀàÆä àÆú-òÆøÀåÈúåÉ, çÆñÆã äåÌà--åÀğÄëÀøÀúåÌ, ìÀòÅéğÅé áÌÀğÅé òÇîÌÈí; òÆøÀåÇú àÂçÉúåÉ âÌÄìÌÈä, òÂåÊğåÉ éÄùÌÒÈà.
17.english: And if a man shall take his sister, his father's daughter, or his mother's daughter, and see her nakedness, and she see his nakedness: it is a shameful thing; and they shall be cut off in the sight of the children of their people: he hath uncovered his sister's nakedness; he shall bear his iniquity.

18.hebrew: åÀàÄéùÑ àÂùÑÆø-éÄùÑÀëÌÇá àÆú-àÄùÌÑÈä ãÌÈåÈä, åÀâÄìÌÈä àÆú-òÆøÀåÈúÈäÌ àÆú-îÀ÷ÉøÈäÌ äÆòÁøÈä, åÀäÄåà, âÌÄìÌÀúÈä àÆú-îÀ÷åÉø ãÌÈîÆéäÈ--åÀğÄëÀøÀúåÌ ùÑÀğÅéäÆí, îÄ÷ÌÆøÆá òÇîÌÈí.
18.english: And if a man shall lie with a woman having her sickness, and shall uncover her nakedness--he hath made naked her fountain, and she hath uncovered the fountain of her blood--both of them shall be cut off from among their people.

19.hebrew: åÀòÆøÀåÇú àÂçåÉú àÄîÌÀêÈ åÇàÂçåÉú àÈáÄéêÈ, ìÉà úÀâÇìÌÅä:  ëÌÄé àÆú-ùÑÀàÅøåÉ äÆòÁøÈä, òÂåÊğÈí éÄùÌÒÈàåÌ.
19.english: And thou shalt not uncover the nakedness of thy mother's sister, nor of thy father's sister; for he hath made naked his near kin; they shall bear their iniquity.

20.hebrew: åÀàÄéùÑ, àÂùÑÆø éÄùÑÀëÌÇá àÆú-ãÌÉãÈúåÉ--òÆøÀåÇú ãÌÉãåÉ, âÌÄìÌÈä; çÆèÀàÈí éÄùÌÒÈàåÌ, òÂøÄéøÄéí éÈîËúåÌ.
20.english: And if a man shall lie with his uncle's wife--he hath uncovered his uncle's nakedness--they shall bear their sin; they shall die childless.

21.hebrew: åÀàÄéùÑ, àÂùÑÆø éÄ÷ÌÇç àÆú-àÅùÑÆú àÈçÄéå--ğÄãÌÈä äÄåà; òÆøÀåÇú àÈçÄéå âÌÄìÌÈä, òÂøÄéøÄéí éÄäÀéåÌ.
21.english: And if a man shall take his brother's wife, it is impurity: he hath uncovered his brother's nakedness; they shall be childless.

22.hebrew: åÌùÑÀîÇøÀúÌÆí àÆú-ëÌÈì-çË÷ÌÉúÇé åÀàÆú-ëÌÈì-îÄùÑÀôÌÈèÇé, åÇòÂùÒÄéúÆí àÉúÈí; åÀìÉà-úÈ÷Äéà àÆúÀëÆí, äÈàÈøÆõ, àÂùÑÆø àÂğÄé îÅáÄéà àÆúÀëÆí ùÑÈîÌÈä, ìÈùÑÆáÆú áÌÈäÌ.
22.english: Ye shall therefore keep all My statutes, and all Mine ordinances, and do them, that the land, whither I bring you to dwell therein, vomit you not out.

23.hebrew: åÀìÉà úÅìÀëåÌ áÌÀçË÷ÌÉú äÇâÌåÉé, àÂùÑÆø-àÂğÄé îÀùÑÇìÌÅçÇ îÄôÌÀğÅéëÆí:  ëÌÄé àÆú-ëÌÈì-àÅìÌÆä òÈùÒåÌ, åÈàÈ÷Ëõ áÌÈí.
23.english: And ye shall not walk in the customs of the nation, which I am casting out before you; for they did all these things, and therefore I abhorred them.

24.hebrew: åÈàÉîÇø ìÈëÆí, àÇúÌÆí úÌÄéøÀùÑåÌ àÆú-àÇãÀîÈúÈí, åÇàÂğÄé àÆúÌÀğÆğÌÈä ìÈëÆí ìÈøÆùÑÆú àÉúÈäÌ, àÆøÆõ æÈáÇú çÈìÈá åÌãÀáÈùÑ:  àÂğÄé éÀäåÈä àÁìÉäÅéëÆí, àÂùÑÆø-äÄáÀãÌÇìÀúÌÄé àÆúÀëÆí îÄï-äÈòÇîÌÄéí.
24.english: But I have said unto you: 'Ye shall inherit their land, and I will give it unto you to possess it, a land flowing with milk and honey.' I am the LORD your God, who have set you apart from the peoples.

25.hebrew: åÀäÄáÀãÌÇìÀúÌÆí áÌÅéï-äÇáÌÀäÅîÈä äÇèÌÀäÉøÈä, ìÇèÌÀîÅàÈä, åÌáÅéï-äÈòåÉó äÇèÌÈîÅà, ìÇèÌÈäÉø; åÀìÉà-úÀùÑÇ÷ÌÀöåÌ àÆú-ğÇôÀùÑÉúÅéëÆí áÌÇáÌÀäÅîÈä åÌáÈòåÉó, åÌáÀëÉì àÂùÑÆø úÌÄøÀîÉùÒ äÈàÂãÈîÈä, àÂùÑÆø-äÄáÀãÌÇìÀúÌÄé ìÈëÆí, ìÀèÇîÌÅà.
25.english: Ye shall therefore separate between the clean beast and the unclean, and between the unclean fowl and the clean; and ye shall not make your souls detestable by beast, or by fowl, or by any thing wherewith the ground teemeth, which I have set apart for you to hold unclean.

26.hebrew: åÄäÀéÄéúÆí ìÄé ÷ÀãÉùÑÄéí, ëÌÄé ÷ÈãåÉùÑ àÂğÄé éÀäåÈä; åÈàÇáÀãÌÄì àÆúÀëÆí îÄï-äÈòÇîÌÄéí, ìÄäÀéåÉú ìÄé.
26.english: And ye shall be holy unto Me; for I the LORD am holy, and have set you apart from the peoples, that ye should be Mine.

27.hebrew: åÀàÄéùÑ àåÉ-àÄùÌÑÈä, ëÌÄé-éÄäÀéÆä áÈäÆí àåÉá àåÉ éÄãÌÀòÉğÄé--îåÉú éåÌîÈúåÌ; áÌÈàÆáÆï éÄøÀâÌÀîåÌ àÉúÈí, ãÌÀîÅéäÆí áÌÈí.  {ô}
27.english: A man also or a woman that divineth by a ghost or a familiar spirit, shall surely be put to death; they shall stone them with stones; their blood shall be upon them. {P}

1.hebrew: וַיֹּאמֶר יְהוָה אֶל-מֹשֶׁה, אֱמֹר אֶל-הַכֹּהֲנִים בְּנֵי אַהֲרֹן; וְאָמַרְתָּ אֲלֵהֶם, לְנֶפֶשׁ לֹא-יִטַּמָּא בְּעַמָּיו.
1.english: And the LORD said unto Moses: Speak unto the priests the sons of Aaron, and say unto them: There shall none defile himself for the dead among his people;

2.hebrew: כִּי, אִם-לִשְׁאֵרוֹ, הַקָּרֹב, אֵלָיו:  לְאִמּוֹ וּלְאָבִיו, וְלִבְנוֹ וּלְבִתּוֹ וּלְאָחִיו.
2.english: except for his kin, that is near unto him, for his mother, and for his father, and for his son, and for his daughter, and for his brother;

3.hebrew: וְלַאֲחֹתוֹ הַבְּתוּלָה הַקְּרוֹבָה אֵלָיו, אֲשֶׁר לֹא-הָיְתָה לְאִישׁ--לָהּ, יִטַּמָּא.
3.english: and for his sister a virgin, that is near unto him, that hath had no husband, for her may he defile himself.

4.hebrew: לֹא יִטַּמָּא, בַּעַל בְּעַמָּיו--לְהֵחַלּוֹ.
4.english: He shall not defile himself, being a chief man among his people, to profane himself.

5.hebrew: לֹא-יקרחה (יִקְרְחוּ) קָרְחָה בְּרֹאשָׁם, וּפְאַת זְקָנָם לֹא יְגַלֵּחוּ; וּבִבְשָׂרָם--לֹא יִשְׂרְטוּ, שָׂרָטֶת.
5.english: They shall not make baldness upon their head, neither shall they shave off the corners of their beard, nor make any cuttings in their flesh.

6.hebrew: קְדֹשִׁים יִהְיוּ, לֵאלֹהֵיהֶם, וְלֹא יְחַלְּלוּ, שֵׁם אֱלֹהֵיהֶם:  כִּי אֶת-אִשֵּׁי יְהוָה לֶחֶם אֱלֹהֵיהֶם, הֵם מַקְרִיבִם--וְהָיוּ קֹדֶשׁ.
6.english: They shall be holy unto their God, and not profane the name of their God; for the offerings of the LORD made by fire, the bread of their God, they do offer; therefore they shall be holy.

7.hebrew: אִשָּׁה זֹנָה וַחֲלָלָה לֹא יִקָּחוּ, וְאִשָּׁה גְּרוּשָׁה מֵאִישָׁהּ לֹא יִקָּחוּ:  כִּי-קָדֹשׁ הוּא, לֵאלֹהָיו.
7.english: They shall not take a woman that is a harlot, or profaned; neither shall they take a woman put away from her husband; for he is holy unto his God.

8.hebrew: וְקִדַּשְׁתּוֹ--כִּי-אֶת-לֶחֶם אֱלֹהֶיךָ, הוּא מַקְרִיב; קָדֹשׁ, יִהְיֶה-לָּךְ--כִּי קָדוֹשׁ, אֲנִי יְהוָה מְקַדִּשְׁכֶם.
8.english: Thou shalt sanctify him therefore; for he offereth the bread of thy God; he shall be holy unto thee; for I the LORD, who sanctify you, am holy.

9.hebrew: וּבַת אִישׁ כֹּהֵן, כִּי תֵחֵל לִזְנוֹת--אֶת-אָבִיהָ הִיא מְחַלֶּלֶת, בָּאֵשׁ תִּשָּׂרֵף.  {ס}
9.english: And the daughter of any priest, if she profane herself by playing the harlot, she profaneth her father: she shall be burnt with fire. {S}

10.hebrew: וְהַכֹּהֵן הַגָּדוֹל מֵאֶחָיו אֲשֶׁר-יוּצַק עַל-רֹאשׁוֹ שֶׁמֶן הַמִּשְׁחָה, וּמִלֵּא אֶת-יָדוֹ, לִלְבֹּשׁ, אֶת-הַבְּגָדִים--אֶת-רֹאשׁוֹ לֹא יִפְרָע, וּבְגָדָיו לֹא יִפְרֹם.
10.english: And the priest that is highest among his brethren, upon whose head the anointing oil is poured, and that is consecrated to put on the garments, shall not let the hair of his head go loose, nor rend his clothes;

11.hebrew: וְעַל כָּל-נַפְשֹׁת מֵת, לֹא יָבֹא:  לְאָבִיו וּלְאִמּוֹ, לֹא יִטַּמָּא.
11.english: neither shall he go in to any dead body, nor defile himself for his father, or for his mother;

12.hebrew: וּמִן-הַמִּקְדָּשׁ, לֹא יֵצֵא, וְלֹא יְחַלֵּל, אֵת מִקְדַּשׁ אֱלֹהָיו:  כִּי נֵזֶר שֶׁמֶן מִשְׁחַת אֱלֹהָיו, עָלָיו--אֲנִי יְהוָה.
12.english: neither shall he go out of the sanctuary, nor profane the sanctuary of his God; for the consecration of the anointing oil of his God is upon him: I am the LORD.

13.hebrew: וְהוּא, אִשָּׁה בִבְתוּלֶיהָ יִקָּח.
13.english: And he shall take a wife in her virginity.

14.hebrew: אַלְמָנָה וּגְרוּשָׁה וַחֲלָלָה זֹנָה, אֶת-אֵלֶּה לֹא יִקָּח:  כִּי אִם-בְּתוּלָה מֵעַמָּיו, יִקַּח אִשָּׁה.
14.english: A widow, or one divorced, or a profaned woman, or a harlot, these shall he not take; but a virgin of his own people shall he take to wife.

15.hebrew: וְלֹא-יְחַלֵּל זַרְעוֹ, בְּעַמָּיו:  כִּי אֲנִי יְהוָה, מְקַדְּשׁוֹ.  {ס}
15.english: And he shall not profane his seed among his people; for I am the LORD who sanctify him. {S}

16.hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּר יְהוָה, אֶל-מֹשֶׁה לֵּאמֹר.
16.english: And the LORD spoke unto Moses, saying:

17.hebrew: דַּבֵּר אֶל-אַהֲרֹן, לֵאמֹר:  אִישׁ מִזַּרְעֲךָ לְדֹרֹתָם, אֲשֶׁר יִהְיֶה בוֹ מוּם--לֹא יִקְרַב, לְהַקְרִיב לֶחֶם אֱלֹהָיו.
17.english: Speak unto Aaron, saying: Whosoever he be of thy seed throughout their generations that hath a blemish, let him not approach to offer the bread of his God.

18.hebrew: כִּי כָל-אִישׁ אֲשֶׁר-בּוֹ מוּם, לֹא יִקְרָב:  אִישׁ עִוֵּר אוֹ פִסֵּחַ, אוֹ חָרֻם אוֹ שָׂרוּעַ.
18.english: For whatsoever man he be that hath a blemish, he shall not approach: a blind man, or a lame, or he that hath any thing maimed, or anything too long,

19.hebrew: אוֹ אִישׁ, אֲשֶׁר-יִהְיֶה בוֹ שֶׁבֶר רָגֶל, אוֹ, שֶׁבֶר יָד.
19.english: or a man that is broken-footed, or broken-handed,

20.hebrew: אוֹ-גִבֵּן אוֹ-דַק, אוֹ תְּבַלֻּל בְּעֵינוֹ, אוֹ גָרָב אוֹ יַלֶּפֶת, אוֹ מְרוֹחַ אָשֶׁךְ.
20.english: or crook-backed, or a dwarf, or that hath his eye overspread, or is scabbed, or scurvy, or hath his stones crushed;

21.hebrew: כָּל-אִישׁ אֲשֶׁר-בּוֹ מוּם, מִזֶּרַע אַהֲרֹן הַכֹּהֵן--לֹא יִגַּשׁ, לְהַקְרִיב אֶת-אִשֵּׁי יְהוָה:  מוּם בּוֹ--אֵת לֶחֶם אֱלֹהָיו, לֹא יִגַּשׁ לְהַקְרִיב.
21.english: no man of the seed of Aaron the priest, that hath a blemish, shall come nigh to offer the offerings of the LORD made by fire; he hath a blemish; he shall not come nigh to offer the bread of his God.

22.hebrew: לֶחֶם אֱלֹהָיו, מִקָּדְשֵׁי הַקֳּדָשִׁים, וּמִן-הַקֳּדָשִׁים, יֹאכֵל.
22.english: He may eat the bread of his God, both of the most holy, and of the holy.

23.hebrew: אַךְ אֶל-הַפָּרֹכֶת לֹא יָבֹא, וְאֶל-הַמִּזְבֵּחַ לֹא יִגַּשׁ--כִּי-מוּם בּוֹ; וְלֹא יְחַלֵּל אֶת-מִקְדָּשַׁי, כִּי אֲנִי יְהוָה מְקַדְּשָׁם.
23.english: Only he shall not go in unto the veil, nor come nigh unto the altar, because he hath a blemish; that he profane not My holy places; for I am the LORD who sanctify them.

24.hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּר מֹשֶׁה, אֶל-אַהֲרֹן וְאֶל-בָּנָיו, וְאֶל-כָּל-בְּנֵי, יִשְׂרָאֵל.  {פ}
24.english: So Moses spoke unto Aaron, and to his sons, and unto all the children of Israel. {P}

1.english: And the LORD spoke unto Moses, saying:

2.hebrew: ††гћ«бћ≈ш а∆м-а«д¬ш…п еја∆м-бћ»р»йе, ејйƒрћ»жјшећ оƒчћ»гјщ—≈й бјр≈й-йƒщ“јш»а≈м, ејм…а йјз«мћјмећ, а∆ъ-щ—≈н ч»гјщ—ƒй--а¬щ—∆ш д≈н о«чјгћƒщ—ƒйн мƒй, а¬рƒй йјде»д.
2.english: Speak unto Aaron and to his sons, that they separate themselves from the holy things of the children of Israel, which they hallow unto Me, and that they profane not My holy name: I am the LORD.
